Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdnNick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights 2 weeks ago while we took our two kids (3 years and 5 months old) to Disney. Our 3 yr old slept on the sofa bed in the separate living room which he thought was awesome because it was a hidden bed but I don't think it would have been very comfortable for an adult, fine for kids though. The kitchen was a nice size and fully stocked with dishes, fridge/freezer, cooktop, microwave and dishwasher. Our room overlooked the pool which looked nice we didn't get a chance to use it as we were too tired from Disney. The room size was nice for the 4 of us and had lots of room for the kids to play and a crib. We were very happy we decided to stay in a 1 bdrm suite instead of a standard room. The location was great it was about 5 minutes from Downtown Disney and was very easy to get to all the Disney parks. It would have been a good location for Universal Studios or Seaworld if we wanted to go there. It was very close to a bunch of restaurants that you pass on your way in and out of Disney. The breakfast was good, it wasn't amazing but was a good way to start the day and there was enough variety to keep all of us happy. The Mickey Mouse waffle was a big hit with our son.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for disney, sea world and universal”
Reviews.Author: bigstays
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Homewood Suites LBV, for 2 weeks in April and absolutely loved it. The hotel public rooms are really clean and smell really fresh. There is a business centre for everyone to use with 2 computers and a printer. It was never busy and always available when we needed it. The suites are great and really comfortable – home from home. There is a small kitchen with coffee-maker, microwave, full size fridge and dish-washer. The housekeeper supplied tea, coffee etc., dishwasher powder and kitchen roll. We also had fresh tea-towels and dish cloths every day. The suites were a great size for the 3 of us. There was a 2 seater sofa and chair in the lounge. We chose a 2 room suite (2 large double beds). The second tv in the bedroom was perfect for our daughter. The only down side was that ours was a smoking room and the smell did not dissipate for the whole fortnight. Our room overlooked the pool and we had a wonderful view over a lake – we watched the sunset and Magic Kingdom fireworks every night at 10pm! Hotel reception said they try to allocate long stay guests a room away from the I4. We kept our air-con on all day – it is doubtful you would hear much above that! The breakfast was perfectly adequate with several different hot items each day – sausage, scrambled egg, gravy, scones, oatmeal. There were 3 waffle machines (including 2 Mickey shaped ones). There were always 2 cereals which appealed to adults and kids. There was also bread, muffins, doughnuts and fruit. The tea and coffee was on tap 24 hours a day with flavoured coffee-mate (hazelnut and French vanilla) as well of milk – YUM!! The staff working at both meal-times worked really hard, clearing tables and topping up food and drinks. One man – Jean-Louis, was superb – such a lovely guy and so hard working – ‘Hello my friend!!!’ The hotel has a ‘social hour’ for 2 hours – 5.30 – 7.30pm – Monday to Thursday. We just thought this would be chips and dips, but it was actually a proper dinner, which served us well on several evenings, accompanied with a cool beer or wine. The menu changed every day over a month and was not duplicated in our fortnight. The food is good quality, and plentiful – good ‘home-cooking’. Examples of food cheese stuffed pasta shells, green beans, garlic bread and Caesar salad jacket potatoes, broccoli cheese and salad bar with toppings meatballs, spaghetti, corn on the cob and mixed salad The hotel pool is shared with Hilton Garden Inn but it was never too busy for us to enjoy. The pool has a zero-entry, ideal for the little ones and a mushroom water feature. There is also a Jacuzzi which was great to relax in. The pool was lit so beautifully in the evening. There is a gym in a separate building with good quality machines to use. TIP - In the morning the main lift nearest reception becomes fairly busy, but there are 2 other lifts towards the back of the hotel are much less busy. We used a hire car to get around. There are no restaurants within real walking distance to the hotel, but there is a bus stop (no 50) right outside and opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They charge more for NON SMOKING rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times and as far as the rooms go they are very average for this type of hotel. I don't recommend counting on the sleep sofa as a comfortable bed for an adult. The mattress is paper thin and very uncomfortable. They also need to ditch the duvet blankets on the regular bed. This is FLORIDA we don't need to keep warm at night. I would not stay here unless I had no choice. The Parc Soleil across the street is an infinitely better place to stay and the room rates are often right on par with Homewood. What really made we want to review this hotel again is that they have now started charging EXTRA for NON SMOKING rooms. NOBODY should agree to pay more because they DON'T smoke! I can't imagine what marketing genius dreamed up this idea but it is absolutely awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not usual quality of Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Hotelpro2
Reviews.Content: I searched many hotels before I booked this property on line. I have been in the hospitality industry for many years and the Homewood Suites brand works for our large family when taking family vacations. This hotel did not have a clean appearance. Our guest room smelled like urine when we checked in at midnight after an 18 hour drive. The smell was strong in the living room area and the bedroom. There were no other rooms available. Housekeeping came up and sprayed some chemicals on the area which aggravated my son's asthma. After noticing some other housekeeping issues in the hotel, we were not satisfied with the cleanliness so we checked out the following morning. I had alerted the front desk the night before and asked them to leave a notice for the front office manager or GM. That was not done. The next morning they said my 5 day reservation could not be refunded. The GM of the sister property was there and he said he would rectify the situation and send me a check since it was booked through bookit.com. This was on April 5th and I have not recieved a refund yet. I dont know if the problems were due to a busy time of year and running at full occuppancy but those are issues that management must address.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Disney”
Reviews.Author: orinocoWilton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last week and found it to be a fantastic place to stay when going to Disney theme parks. The previous 4 nights we had stayed in a 4.5 star property elsewhere in Orlando (work paid!), and Homewood was very close in standard and comfort to the other hotel. Given the very reasonable nightly rate for this property, the standard was excellent. The complimentary transfer to Disney was very handy and saved $$ compared to other hotels. The complimentary morning breakfast was also very good with a decent choice of foods. Add to these the weeknight managers reception complimentary dinner, and it saves considerable money compared to staying elsewhere. The pool was very clean and much less crowded than those we saw at the disney resorts. The room was new and clean, with comfortable beds and was very quiet. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Below our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: victorw
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Orlando trip during 13-19 April 2012. After spending 6 nights at the hotel, we found that it was below our expectations. The room should be refurbished, although the bed was okay. Hot breakfast items every morning were almost the same with salty sausage and potatoes. The glasses for cold drink were dirty and unclean. One day we found that the hotel experienced the shortage of foods, yogurt, and fruits without notice to the guests. Comparing to other branches of Homewood Suites, this hotel with their location in the tourist area should be repositioned itself and re-manage the process as well as refurbishing as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Infaith07
Reviews.Content: Hello, my husband and I just recently returned from a weekly stay at the Homewood Suites in Lake Buena Vista. Let me start out by staying we have stayed in some really wonderful Homewood Suites in the past and although not bad, this hotel was not what we would deem “typical” Homewood Suites standards. That being said, this is not a bad hotel. Here are the facts, from our point of view. External Hotel - The grounds are very well kept. This hotel shares a pool and workout facility with the Hilton Garden Inn located next door. I felt very safe at night walking around the property. Breakfast – The breakfast starts at 6:30 a.m. during the week and typically features eggs, sausage, waffles, etc. It is really a good breakfast before heading out. Quick tip, get there when it opens. Due to the mass amounts of people staying at the hotel, it is very much a stampede getting to the food. Laundry Facilities - This hotel only has one floor with washer and dryers. There is three of each and they are pretty expensive to use, each were $2.00 a use. In the Homewood Suites we have previously stayed in there were free washer and dryers on each floor. We thought it would be the same here and was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. Room – I have really mixed feelings here. The hotel is only three years old, but the rooms and their décor look a little worn. The furniture had not been whipped down and the sofa and chair had stains on them and the blankets had holes in them. The first night we were there we had to be relocated to another room. Upon check in we noticed some very strong odors in our room. We had a non-smoking room and we could tell it was not smoke. It was more of a very strong “nasty” food odor. The bathroom also smelled a little like sewage water. We were able to switch rooms. The food smell had to have been from the previous person cooking something strong in the room and without being able to crack a window, the food smell just lingered. We were never able to escape the sewage water smell because it was coming from the local water in the area. The room was clean, the beds were comfy and the A/C works really, really well and is individually controlled. Quick tip, ask for a room way from the interstate. The hotel is located next to the interstate. If you are a lite sleeper staying in a room away from the interstate will help out significantly. Customer Service – Really good, no complaints here at all. The staff was very nice and very helpful and greeted us each morning and night. This was not a bad hotel and very affordable, but just not 100% what we expected. It also offered a free shuttle to the parks. And there are lots of shops and restaurants close to the hotel. I will tell you this; while we were there we had one down day and decided to check out some other hotel options for my husband’s sister that is travel to Orlando in October with her son. We visited a couple of Disney properties and two other Hilton properties in the area. For the money, Disney properties are not the best option. Offsite properties offer more amenities, and tend to be a lot more affordable. This hotel and so many others are so close to the parks that the it takes hardly any time to drive there. Okay I have written way too much. Please email me if you have any questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: duggem
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Homewood Suites when we travel as a family because of their large rooms, comfortable beds, kitchenettes and great breakfasts. This location was no exception - well run, helpful and affordable. Disney was a short distance away and the hotel had a scheduled shuttle bus that worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Dirty, gross and terrible service! Stayed between April 3rd to 6th 2012. We had a late check in. We had called them way before hand to let them know we would be late. When we arrived they had given away our non-smoking room. However, I am inclined to think they messed up our reservation because when I called to let them know we were going to have a late check in they confirmed our room as smoking but we reserved non-smoking. The operator quickly corrected themselves to say our room was indeed non-smoking. When we arrived to find our stinking smoking room they apologized and told us they would try to change it the next day. They did not have any nonsmoking rooms the next day and we never spoke to a manager the entire time. We were with our children who are not used to smoke. I asked for some kind of compensation and was told the manager would get back to me but never heard from the manager. Our room was disgusting; it had long black hairs all over the bathtub and shower walls. We had to call them twice to come clean the bathroom. We also moved the couch to retrieve a toy and it was so dusty and more even more hair, they obviously no not vacuum properly. I will never go back to this hotel again. I found most of the staff unknowledgeable and passing the buck to a manager that did not seem to exist.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home.”
Reviews.Author: bslansky
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel. We stayed in the 2 bedroom/2 bath suite and it was just as comfortable as being at home. The breakfast buffet was an added plus, especially the Mickey waffles. The service was superior at the front desk. Very convenient to everything. And a free shuttle to the parks. Yay! And, super clean.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: sidjed
Reviews.Content: Our suite was spacious and comfortable. The staff that handled the breakfasts and dinners were outstanding, they really worked hard. Road noise from I-4 was loud, but we kept the fan on high and that drowned it out. Our only problem was discovering that the top sheet on our bed had a bloodstain on it that had matter in it so we knew it was fresh. Reported it to the front desk and they said they were contact housekeeping and have the sheets changed. To them this was no big deal, the manager never contacted us to apologize. The next day we asked if they were aware of this situation, and we were just brushed off. She asked us did we want a basket, as if to say don't bother us with this. it left a bad taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “run of the mill”
Reviews.Author: wicky144
Reviews.Content: Very basic suite layout and furnishings. Breakfast was very good if you could get a seat. The pool is shared by anoth adjoining hotel. The rear of the property is very close to the freeway and all the traffic noise so those rooms are not desireable. The property is newer and they offer free dinner nightly.

Reviews.Title: “Viagem Disney Ano Novo 2011-2012”
Reviews.Author: marcoforini
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very cozy, staff is good. Bedroom is in a good size and clean. The negative point for me is that the Breakfast starts only at 7am and since this is a vacation hotel where people usually goes to the Parks (Disney, Universal, Busch Gardens and etc) usually you have to be tehre early, especially on the busy season (Summer - Dec;Jan), so would be nice to have the breakfast starting around 6am. P`rice is good and in my opinion fair. It is close to restaurants and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLukeCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a safe choice, if you just need at pleasant place to stay, close to everything. The rooms are very nice, clean and spacious, but because of the nearby highway, there are a lot of noise from heavy traffic, even in the nights. If this means something to you, be sure to get a room away from the highway. (I guess 50% of the rooms are facing the highway). You should also know that if you intends to do some sunbathing in the sunshine state, this is not the right place. They have a pool without heating (cold in winter), and with little place for sunbathing. The staff was very nice and friendly, and breakfast was free. Internet was working like a charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: KCmusiclady
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice Homewood Suites in Orlando. Location is great since it is not directly on a major thoroughfare with lots of outside noise. Only noise we did encounter was from the free-way on 1 side of the hotel, so you might want to stay away from that side if you can help it. The suite was typical Homewood with cleanliness a top priority. Lovely kitchen with attractive dinnerware and nice cooking utensils. 2 TVs with even a DVD player with the TV in the living room area. We didn't use the pool or the hot tub, but we did investigate the area and it was lovely. If you are on a tight budget this place is worth paying a bit more. You do have breakfast available and a "light" dinner with beverages and salad. The dinner is comparable to what most people serve at home: salad, bread, main course, veggie. We took advantage of it both nights we were there and were quite pleased. By the way, from reading one review, I guess some parents were not very responsible with their children at the breakfast. I did not experience this, in fact the hotel staff were very careful at the evening meals to be quite attentive when the children started to get a little out of hand. One problem I had with this hotel was the breakfast choices. I can't say that a nutritionist was on board to help with the offerings. The only dry cereals were both sugary (fruit loops, frosted flakes). Carbohydrate heaven (bagels, english muffins, bread, waffles), yogurt (none of this was fat free or low fat), fried potatoes, scrambled eggs with peppers (not a great morning food), and white looking sausage patties. There was apples and bananas and some juices. Sorry , but if these were my choices 3-4 days in a row I would gain 4 pounds even with walking miles in an amusement park and leave with high cholesterol. There was no edible protein with the choices from this spread. The Hamptons at least offer low fat yogurt and healthier dry cereals with oat bran or wheat flakes. I'd like to see all of the Hilton Chain be a bit more consistent with their morning breakfast fare. Sugar free syrup was available and skim milk, but if you use both these products on the high calorie unhealthy choices, what's the use? Granted, I am sensitive to food now that I just went from a size 16 down to a size 10 this past year on a nationally known weight program. But why should I be positive about a breakfast that I can't eat because it is mostly unhealthy choices? I'd stay there again, and buy my own yogurt, Cheerios, or whole wheat bran flakes if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location - but watch out for the elevators!”
Reviews.Author: magwiech
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, spacious room at a reasonable price. Close to everything, although due to the traffic in the area, give yourself plenty of time to get to even the closest places. Our suite had full fridge, sink, microwave, stove, dishwasher. Small kitchen table, nice size sitting room and large bedroom & bath, overlooking a lovely swimming pool with a fountain. Hot breakfast had great choices but was crazy busy! Very long wait to make your own waffle and no supervision over kids making their waffles and touching everything...yuk. We had an unfortunate incident during our stay...the elevator sensor wasn't working properly and closed hard on an elderly member of our group. She was badly bruised and it put a damper on our weekend. The manager apologized and reported the problem to maintenance. He gave her a few Tylenol tablets from hotel shop at no charge. (We actually expected him to offer to comp her room share or offer her SOMETHING, but a few Tylenol was it - really not cool.) However, other than the unfortunate incident, the room & the location were great.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: epc2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because the Parc Soleil was sold out , Been a Hilton I thought it was going to be similar but not at all. Room was clean , but noisy, The walls are thin the AC in our room was very noisy ,hallway carpets have stains and no tub. Internet is complimentary but very slow. Also one of the front desk was not the most friendly person when I asked about staying another night because I booked two nights and decided to stay one more night and looks like the hotel was sold out , I can undertsand that but staff can be more friendly.,Thank God I found a room at the Parc Soleil and moved there.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ShannonSharpe
Reviews.Content: I was coming into town a few days before a conference and picked this because it seemed close to things and had free breakfast...Well, it's the last hotel on the street, cannot walk to anything....They have a free shuttle to downtown disney, the parks and outlets but nothing else. You have to pay for everythign else. The breakfast was less than desirable and I think made us sick. Nice pool, very small basketball court. In summary, it was just ok, but if you have kids, and going to the park, it is economical.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alarmist
Reviews.Content: Nice suites, roomy, close to disney world. They have a shuttle that takes you to and from disney at designated times. Breakfast was very good, computer room was free internet searches. Would definitely stay again, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, love it.”
Reviews.Author: cake1245
Reviews.Content: Very glad to have found this hotel in Orlando. Very modern and upscale decor in the lobby and dining area. Hallway looks very clean and neat. Love the computer room with free printing. We had a 1 bedroom suite, very spacious and clean. Breakfast is fantastic with friendly staff constantly refill the food and drinks. The free dinner from Mon-Thur is unbeatable. Even though it's free, they manage to have different menu items every day throughout the month, very impressed. Food quality was mostly good although one night the meatloaf was super salty and almost inedible. The room with the vanity area separated from the bath and toilet is a good idea but it would be better if there is a door to separate that with the bedroom. When the kids are asleep at night I couldn't use the hair dryer in the vanity area as it would wake them up. Other than that, the hotel is excellent with great location and amenitiies. Highly recommended. You won't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: willowrun08
Reviews.Content: Great location....near attractions, shopping, and restaurants. Clean. Roomy Rooms Pleasant staff Hot Breakfast Free Dinner M-Th Coffee in room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: saxonkc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Homewood Suites on three different occasions over the past 2 years and everytime it is as pleasant or better than our previous stay. The rooms are spacious and always clean and cozy. We travel with our 8 year old daughter, so it is nice to have the fold out sofa in the living area which is seperate from the main sleeping area. Also having a kitchenette with stove top and fridge is a great option for long stays or budget concious travelers. They have a free breakfast every morning with cereals, juice, coffee, two hot entrees and "Mickey Mouse" waffles you make yourself. Our daughter loves coming here and we do as well. I find this is not typical of most hotels around Disney because it does not feel over-run with kids every where screaming :).

Reviews.Title: “service with a smile....and then some”
Reviews.Author: butchartd
Reviews.Content: We knew that the Homewood Suites on Marbella Palm Court was going to be good. The Trip Advisor Reviews were just too good not to be. However, as nice as the hotel is physically -- the lobby, the dining area, the pool -- it's the outstanding service that makes the difference. Some reviews reflect accurately that the rooms could use some new furniture or that there are some stains on the carpets in the hallways. True. But the room we had was large and clean. Moreover, if we wanted something, baby crib or plates or directions...you name it, the people at the front desk are excellent. Thank you, Matt (the manager), for making our stay a memorable one; your attention to detail was remarkable and appreciated. And thank you, Jean Pierre, for making breakfast a wonderful experience every day. Great team work at the Homewood Suites benefits everyone and we will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stays in 3 Years!”
Reviews.Author: Pat-in-S-Fla
Reviews.Content: Stayed once for pleasure and three times for business and pleasure combination trips (8 nights this trip). I love it and will be back again within the year. Spacious suites with full kitchens (even a dishwasher), 1 flat screen tvs (one with a dvd player), 24/7 fitness center, beautiful pool and jacuzzi; free USA Today M-F. Mon-Thurs free beer and wine with a homestyle dinner from 5-7; hot and cold breakfast buffet every morning. OK, so it's not organic, vegetarian or vegan, but you can pick and choose! The staff is pleasant and eager to please. I always choose a room away from the elevator, but it IS close to Disney so it's a family facility -- always good to have your earplugs with you just in case. Before I discovered Homewood Suites, I used to stay close by --twice the price and less than 1/2 the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD VALUE - IF YOUR NOT A VERY LIGHT SLEEPER”
Reviews.Author: Heisler49
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights out of 5 booked. Rooms have everything you need if you like preparing your own meals, plus they have a free breakfast & evening meal some evenings. All in all, very good value for the cost & a good set up for families doing Disney World As noted by another reviewer, some parts of the Hotel are in need of freshening up, [hall carpets for instance, and our room looked a bit tired] We like the Homewood Suites concept & value they represent & have stayed at the one in Asheville, NC, which felt fresher. Used the recreation room, equipment was in very good condition. Main drawback was we didn't realize that Hotel backs on to the 8 lane I4 freeway & being a light sleeper, I was woken 3am to 4am most mornings by what I assume were semis trucking in goods for the Outlet Mall the other side of the freeway. & we weren't on the side directly facing the I4. Due to the broken sleep, for the final night decided to move to another Hilton Hotel, literally 1 mile down the road & further away from the I4. This was the Parc Soleil & will review it separately. The Homewood Receptionist was kind enough to credit us the 5th night of our booking.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Delivers Again!”
Reviews.Author: garypcsc
Reviews.Content: I'm beginning to think that Homewood Suites might deliver the best value of all the Hilton brands. This Homewood on Marbella Palm Ct. is in a cluster of three hotels which included a Hilton Garden Inn, this Homewood Suites and a Marriott property. Although easily accessible and convenient to most any Orlando entertainment venue, they are isolated and not in walking distance of anything. Homewood and the Hilton Garden Inn share a nicely landscaped pool and other amenities such as a fitness center. We stayed for three nighs in a king studio suite which was more than adequate for the two of us including a full kitchen, a dining table, sofa, desk, nice size closet, safe and a bathroom with shower (no tub). Don't know if other rooms might have a bath tub. Parties of more than two might prefer a one or more bedroom suite since in a studio, the bedroom is not private. We were also given popcorn on our first night. Homewood offers a full breakfast every morning with the standard staples of hot or cold cereals, fruit, yogurt, bread, english muffins, pastries, bagels and waffles with a rotating selection of eggs, sausage, potatoes, biscuits and sausage gravy and so on. This particular Homewood had some of the best breakfast attendents I have seen. Tables were cleared promptly, cleaned and the food area was always kept spotless and well stocked. The only thing I can think of is that there were no cold cuts or cheese for our European visitors. Homewood also offers a "light" dinner Monday thru Thursday. On the Monday we were there, they offered a fresh salad with choice of dressings (Ken's) plus bratwurst with peppers and onions on a roll (if you want) and large potatoes like steak fries, except they weren't deep fried. No dessert. On the Wednesday we were there, they offered meat ball subs. Again, the meat balls were prepared in a nice tomato sauce with onions and peppers and a fresh salad was available. They also had something like tater tots. No dessert. Lite dinners also included your choice of beer (lite), wine (red or white), lemonade, tea and I'm really not sure about other beverages. The evening dinner attendants were also very prompt at cleaning tables and restocking food items. Our room was cleaned and refreshed every day and towels were changed when we wanted. One warning I would mention. This hotel has a booth that sells Disney and other tickets. Their ticket prices are higher than you can actually get at the parks. They say the premium is for the convenience of not waiting in line at the parks. I say, get to the park early and there are no lines. All in all, I would use this Homewood Suites again when in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yusmairy C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good, it is clean, nice, no smell at all. The breakfast is great. perfest for a family vacation. Close to Disney World Resort

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen G
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about our stay here!! The breakfast was wonderful every morning and monday- friday we were even served dinner. The suites were clean and comfortable. Wonderful pool area with hot tub, basketball court, fitness room as well as a game room. Convenient location too!! We will stay here again next visit to Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Seven
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a base for the Disney Parks and it was an excellent choice. The room was clean and well kept, the maid service was also excellent. The manager went out of his way to provide an egg free waffle mix for us. The location is very convenient to avoid traffic going into Disney and parking is free. The breakfast staff were very friendly - Jean Louis in particular. Thanks for a great stay. The dinner option on Mon-Thu was a bonus. This hotel offers amazing value for a family. The pool is heated and the kids had a great time mid-December. Only things that could be improved were the fridge and ac units were a little loud, however this did not affect us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ryandelany
Reviews.Content: One of the few properties with rooms a family can actually use. This property has 2 bedroom suites with a King bed in one room and 2 Queens in another. For our 4 person family, this couldn't have been more perfect. After a long day at the parks, the kids could go to sleep in a room with an actual door (the Doubletree has faux louvered doors that don't block out light or sound), and we could stay up and watch TV, have a snack, etc. without waking the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Bang for Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: MadforTravel7254
Reviews.Content: The price was great, $80 per night plus modest fees. Free Wi-Fi, free parking, no resort fees and a hot (and cold) breakfast was an added bonus. The one bedroom suite was better than we thought it would be; clean, spacious, the beds were comfortable and it was quiet. For someone who is too often up in the middle of the night, the separate living area was a blessing. Most of the staff was friendly, some exceptionally so. Location was good, close to Disney, dining, etc. A few minor complaints. Tub drained slowly, no thin pillows and the breakfast was not great, BUT it was better than any other free hotel breakfast I have had. The above rating was for the money. The 5 star is obviously not suggesting they are competing with the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: pctravler
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay with this Hotel. It is a little hard to find the first time because it is way in the back of Palm Parkway. This makes it a nice quiet place to stay. Homeword also has 2 bedroom suites with a third room pull-out couch. I like the extra room for my family. Every room looks new and I always feel like I am at Home. They also have a nice pool and hot tub between them and another Hilton Hotel. This hotel is close to Disney and great outlet shopping!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: travelmomof3Kentucky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property the night before checking in to a Disney property. The location was very good and breakfast was nice also. We typically stay at Hampton Inns/Homewood Suites so I know what to expect. This to me was an average hotel. You could see some of the wear--hallway carpets were somewhat stained and the rooms also had some staining on the carpets and spots on walls. They were overall clean but by no means what I have come to expect when staying in a Homewood Suites. Our sheets had some rips in them. The pull out sofa bed was atrocious. My daughter said she felt springs in her back all night long. Breakfast area was nice but the attendant was somewhat pushy and constantly "helping." Yes I know how to cook a waffle and don't need help. If I had asked that would be different. She was just too helpful. Not meaning to be rude but this is offputting to some people, myself included. Would I stay here for an overnight trip again? Probably if the price was right. Would I stay for longer? Nope

Reviews.Title: “Great and affordable place”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn R
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites Lake Buena Vista was a great place to stay. The location was perfect, since we had activities both north of Orlando, as well as Disney and Universal. We had a 1 bedroom suite (there was a mix-up by the reservation service, but the hotel made it right). The rooms were clean, large and comfortable. The breakfast was substantial, and the eating area had a nice atmosphere. The hotel staff was friendly and service-oriented. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jay C
Reviews.Content: The suite type room was clean and comfortable. It had a fully equipped kitchen and 1 32 inch TV in the living room area and another in the bedroom. The air conditioner in the room was a little on the warm side since I did not have a thermostat in the room to make it cooler but there was a ceiling fan that you can turn on. Besides those minor inconveniences the only other 2 suggestions are that they could improve their pool or recreational area since it seemed kind of small and closed in and they could also improve their child gaming section since they only had 3 arcade games plus their gym area could use some improvements as well. overall my stay at the hotel was great. Friendly staff, clean rooms, excellent breakfast service, centrally located to parks (Universal Theme Parks are closer than Disney Parks) and shopping centers and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient for value-conscious families”
Reviews.Author: Manekshaw
Reviews.Content: Concur with several reviews about how convenient the location is for all major attractions in the area - Disney, Seaworld. Also close to several restaurants and the factory outlet shopping location, and only about 20 minutes from the Interbational airport. The property is very clean with lots of facilities for families, and is very safe. Great customer service - the employees always smiled when service is requested. We got a 1-bedroom suite for $98 per day during Halloween week (with AAA discount), which we thought was a steal given that free, hot breakfast is included for that price. The beds were really comfortable and pillows were soft. We couldn't have asked for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top”
Reviews.Author: sheltoe19028
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a couple days a few weeks ago. I was impressed from the start. We got to this hotel EARLY bout 9 or 10 am with luggage in the car. They let us check in early and eat breakfast which was about to end for the day. I had a problem w/the DVD player and they was Jonny On the Spot service. I was back to watching DVDs in no time. The staff was very courteous and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough...”
Reviews.Author: jimmy_d_olson
Reviews.Content: I've grown to like this chain alot. Nicest breakfast around, included in the pricetag. As with alot of Orlando hotels, though, this one has way too many kids, and there was NO room for many folks to sit during the height of b'fast hours. The other concern I had was the lack of decent running nearby, but that's endemic to the area, not specific to the hotel. The room was fine, however, and no issues at all with any of the staff. I rank this one below the one in which I stayed the previous night near the Albany, NY airport. That one was superior, both in terms of the breakfast seating, breakfast selection, and the overall condition of the property (also fewer kids!) Running there was also better.

Reviews.Title: “Quick overnight trip”
Reviews.Author: mpiekarski
Reviews.Content: We went up for a quick trip to Orlando from Sarasota. We needed a place to stay for the evening, and didn't feel like paying resort prices. The Homewood Suites was a nice hotel. Great Hot Tub! Check in was a little rough, it looked light more staff was needed to handle the volume. We had a room that faced the highway but you really didn't hear it at night. Breakfast in the morning was a great amenity, but the food quality wasn't that great. The eggs looked goopy and runny. It was a great property, and it was perfect for what we needed for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: USMuseFan
Reviews.Content: The good...lots of food choices around you. Close to Disney, Sea World, or Universal. It was clean, beds are comfy, and the pool is nice. The people are very nice. The bad...the towels are AWFUL. They are like sandpaper. Very thin and rough. Felt like it was scratching my face. The water smelled awful. Like rotten eggs. From all faucets. The breakfast sucked pretty bad. Didn't even have bacon. It's off the beaten track so it's not the easiest to find. The family we were going with passed it multiple times before they found us.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Days”
Reviews.Author: stabene
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one week here. Our studio suite (bed room/living room/kitchenette/bath)was comfortable, clean and quiet. The well-trained staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were fine, although some higher fiber cereal would be nice. We did not sample the free dinners (Monday to Thursday). We would happily stay here again and plan to recommend it to family and friends. A minor complaint: the internet was S-L-O-W and needed to be re-approved each day. It also appears to be very family friendly. We don't believe you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martyn321
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. The rooms where a really good size, with decent tv's and a nice bath and wash area. The breakfasts where a lot better then expected after reading reviews on this site, though they did get a touch repetative after 4 or 5 days. The room was very quiet, ours overlooked I4, but the noise was not as bad as other people have said, and we had no problems sleeping. Parking was good, and the hotel depsite being off from the main roads was a really great central location to get to any of the parks. Last year we stayed at Hampton Inn and suites on LBV, i would rate these 2 hotels evenly, hampton had a larger open plan style room which seemed bigger, but the breakfast offerings at homewood where more varied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Paddywaggon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a conference in the Convention Centre. Excellent base and great service. The rooms are spacious with a separate bedroom and living/kitchen areas. Fully fitted kitchen with good selection of utensils needed for your stay. There are good sized TV's in each room. The bed was huge, comfortable and plenty of pillows. Staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was very busy most days. Only downside was the signage from International Drive is not very clear but other than that a great place to stay. The inclusive breakfast whilst busy was plentiful and staff quickly cleaned up the tables and replenished items. Parking was good and free. Homewood suites offers a light dinner with drinks Mon-Thur from 5 to 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for the parks!!”
Reviews.Author: Gantravel
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough to praise. From the second we walked in the door after traveling about 30hrs from Australia, the staff were helpful friendly & thoughtful. The rooms were great size clean & comfortable. Family of 5 had great plenty of space to live for 10 days.Beds & furnishings great quality The kitchenette was great to cook some meals. The complimentary breakfast was great. Can't believe other guests have complained about it!! Guest laundry was great always clean, cheap. Has taken me a while to write review as only just joined Tripadvisor, would recommend to anyone to stay here. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 135Mar50
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at Homewood Suites in Orlando from September 19-29th. There were five in our party including a baby. Can't say enough about hotel staff in attending to our every need. This is longer than most people stay at a hotel so I think we got a pretty good observation of how things run at the hotel. We stayed on the 6th floor and our Housekeeping woman was wonderful. Our room was cleaned daily. We had free breakfast every morning and dinner Monday through Thursday. Not my home cooking but adequate. We were especially impresssed with the breakfast. Again, cooks were there to serve and please us. What a nice service. We rented a car because taxis are expensive there and we were close to the freeway and to the parks. Free internet service with copy machine to print our maps for driving directions. Also a plus. Fun swimming pool for children--a titch cold for little ones. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel5812
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 days and found it phenomenal! The rooms were well decorated, clean and modern. We stayed on the 6th floor which was nicely away from foot traffic, however we were looking over the highway but we rarely noticed it over the hum of the air con. The gym was top class for a regular hotel. It had new equipment and i especially liked the addition of free weights. The pool was never busy and it was lovely to use it along with the whirlpool. The location can be a small problem as you really do need a car to get anywhere and the hotel was no more than a 2 minute drive to things like ihop, olive garden, mc Donalds etc.. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and the price for 12 nights was great for the service and quality we got.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPixie
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel and the extra room and kitchen helped ease the pain of not staying on-site at Disney, which we usually do. The extra space in the room really enabled us to be able to stretch out and relax more than in a traditional room at Disney. We had Hilton points for four nights, so traded them in and got a double queen suite overlooking the pool. Hotel is very nice, clean and the complimentary breakfast and light dinners were wonderful. Get to the breakfast early on park days to have enough time to eat--it does get very crowded. The pool area was nicely landscaped and we enjoyed the pool one evening. A very quick drive to Disney, close to restaurants (Sweet Tomatoes!). Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! It was a perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Sergio S
Reviews.Content: We stood in this hotel for15 days, from Aug 22 till sept.5th, and I would like to say that we were very happy with this hotel there in Orlando. We had a great room, extremely clean and he service were quite friendly! We will definitely come back to this hotel and to Orlando! Many thanks to Hoteis.com, trip advisor , and of course tall he staff from the homewood suites by Hilton at Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: shuribob
Reviews.Content: Large suite with kitchen. Nice pool and friendly staff. Some reviewers of this location complained about issues we did not see. We went to Disney everyday and when we got tired we came back and enjoyed the pool which is small but very nice. It was a slower period when we stayed and I'm sure if this location got really busy problems could arise but for couples this location was great. Our room looked out over I-4 and we never heard any noise whatsoever until the garbage truck came early one morning. The food provided for breakfast and dinner, included, was adaquet and saved us money. We stuffed ourselves in the am before we went out and didn't have to pay Disney prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family suite hotel close to Disney and all other attractions.”
Reviews.Author: butterfly1623
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. As soon as you enter it is a welcoming feeling. Very clean and new. The complimentary breakfast buffet was always delicious and changing everyday. It included drinks (milk, coffee/tea,apple juice,orange juice). The kids loved the Mickey Mouse waffles which were available everyday. The rooms were spacious with a seperate bedroom and living/kitchen. TV's in each room. It allowed kids to go into living room and watch tv and/or play while we had some extra time in bed before heading out in the morning. The kitchen contained a full size fridge, stove top, microwave, dishwasher and utensils/mugs/cups/plates. We didn't do any cooking however we stocked the fridge with drinks and treats (to take to attraction parks). The attraction desk is convienent and prices are a little less then purchasing at the parks directly. Instead we found a company that sells only park tickets and tours in Orlando. It is only 7 minutes from the hotel and offers discount tickets with no fees or gimics. See www.orlandofuntickets.com. We purchased tickets locally at their office however you can purchase online. The price quoted online was price charged at their office. The hotel is located approx. 10 min drive to Disney entrance, SeaWorld, Aquatica. Hotel offers shutlle but we never used it. There are few hotels in the area however no restaurants in walking distance. We highly recommend to rent a car. Best deals appear to be with Dollar. (tip-sign up for their email notices to get all car promotions.) The pool was a great size to keep eye on children. There is a walk in shallow area for young kids.Pool and hot tub closes at 10p. The area was always clean. The laundry room was convienent with 3 washers & dryers. We used it however disliked the smell of the water which seems normal in Orlando. Front desk offers detergent and softner sheets for purchase-$1 each. The business center only contained 2 computers. Unfortunately during our stay only 1 computer worked however we were given access to use the computers at the Hilton Garden Inn next door. Homewood suites offers a light dinner with drinks Mon-Thur from 5 to 7pm. We were at the parks during this time however the menu posted on the fridge listed a changing menu everyday for the month. Great way to save by having dinner at hotel for free. Parking was plentiful and free. There is an outlet mall minutes away from hotel (can see it from the parking lot, across the I4). We decided to go to the one on end of International drive but realized it was an unnecessary 25 min drive because the same stores were next to hotel. We througly enjoyed our 8 night stay here and would recommend it to anyone, especially if you love the extra space. We would stay here again and look forward to staying at another Homewood Suites by Hilton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “THE GROUNDS WERE VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: OR F
Reviews.Content: Our trip this august was very nice especially with the service and the clean room we got every day when we came back from the parks a clean room awaited us..however, we were very dissapointed with our view ...it was the parking lot ..and there was no porch to sit out .no transportation to parks except to epcot on a crowded bus that made alot of stops it was very upsetting ,therefore, the driving cost a tidy sum .Thats basicly the reason we would reconsider going back... We would like to thank you all for the gym room that kept us in shape during our stay...THANKS... .

Reviews.Title: “Verify the price when you check in”
Reviews.Author: MS03t1
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was nice, however when we received our bill the price of the room was more than what was agreed on when we booked it over the phone. When we called in they had agreed that they would match the price that we found on the internet. We talked to the front desk about the discrepancy in price and they said that we should have said something when we checked in, but we had let them run our credit card so we would have to pay the higher price. We did call back after leaving and had found the confirmation information which had a confirmation number, but no price. We also had a note with who we talked to when we booked the room and the price and called back with this information and they agreed that the person we talked to does work there and they may have agreed to the price but we had no proof. So my suggestion would be to request that they send the price with the confirmation number and/or when you check in you make sure that you ask the price and have them put it in writing(at check in they did not have us sign or initial anything regarding price as other hotels do). This was very unfortunate because it really put a negative spin on an overall good experience. The hotel is fine. The set up of the rooms is nice and the hotel pool is good. If staying here you definately want to have a car. They have a shuttle but it is very limited. Breakfast is good. Overall we were pleased with the accomodations themselves, just not the outcome of the cost and the indifference of the front desk personnel as to our room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For a Large Family”
Reviews.Author: flygirl123
Reviews.Content: We have four boys, so it can be very difficult to find a hotel that we can fit in. This place is perfect!!!! Two queen beds and a sofa bed. I didn't even know we would have a full kitchen! Full size fridge, Cook top, microwave and dishwasher! Even dishwashing soap! Now get this. Breakfast is included. Eggs and sausage everyday. Cereal, fruit, breads, etc. For free, it was good! Get this, they give unlimited wine or beer in the evening, plus they had a small dinner buffet. The food was very nice for free. But we went out anyway, because we wanted to, but you didn't have to. I sampled the food every night, just so I could write a thorough review, and it was totally adequate, for free. Many families were eating their dinner there. I reserved my room on their website. With a AAA discount I paid $98 dollars a night. I think it is an incredible value. The pool was nice. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “?? UNCERTAIN ???”
Reviews.Author: ladyshayshay
Reviews.Content: My family and I were all excited to be travelling to Orlando for a family vacation. We surfed the net literaly months before deciding where to stay. The Homewood Suites was one of our final three. Finally we decided to give it a go after more positive than negative reviews. The first night we checked in we callled the front desk for extra towels and were told by the gentleman tha t we would have to come downstairs for them. No problem we went and got them. The next day we left our room shrotly after eight and left a tip on the pillow with a request for extra towels and amenities ( seeing that we were travelling with kids who just loved the pool ). We got one extra bath towel. Upon arrival there were three washcloths in the bathroom. That was the only day we had that many washcloths. Everyday it kept dwindlingand dwindly until the final day we got only one. Thank goodness after this observation I went out and purchased washcloths for my family's use . I left a tip on the second day and still no changes. There was a penny on the bathroom floor from the night of arrival until the day of departure. The carpet was never vacuumed and when we returned to our room at after five one afternoon the dirty linen and garbage was still piled high outside our room door, the diswasher was still going and sink was left with bits and pieces of dried salad. On Friday before we left the pillows we left without cases and no one returned to cover them or even provide the shams for them. It is obvious that management puts a lot of emphasis on maintenance of the property. The grounds were beautiful. The laundry facilities were clean and well kept and most of the front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. I got a soda from the vending machine that had expired and the lady at the front desk graciously changed it and apologized. My son borrowed the basketball and while at the pool another guests took it from him. I was told by the lady at the front deask that he was responsible for it and would have to pay. I asked how much it would be and was told the management would get back to me. Later that evening the manager calle dnad advised that he was aware and the there would not be a chrge. We were very grateful for this kind gesture. The breakfast was ok and we ate dinner one night and my sons enjoyed the fettucini. Another good thing is that the room was ready upon check-in. I was quite pleased with the size of the room and the ambience of the property. It was not hard to find and well maintained. My only disappointment was with housekeeping. HOUSEKEEPING WAS HORRIBLE. THE TUB WAS NEVER CLEANED DURING OUR ENTIRE 5 NIGHT STAY. TWO THUMBS DOWN. PENNIES , RECEIPTS AND SMALL PIECES OF DEBRIS WERE LEFT ON THE FLOOR THROUGHOUT OUR STAY. Management please have your supervisors check occupied rooms regularly . This type of service can result in guests not returning and you guys have a beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but luxury”
Reviews.Author: sarahbeey
Reviews.Content: We satyed here for the last 5 days of our Florida holiday. This hotel is out of the way of things so you do need a car, not sure if they have any transport as we had our own hire car. The room was small but had everything we needed, a great size fridge and the kitchen area was just enough, it came with utensils, plates and bowls etc although these were not replaced daily by house keeping who took them away to be washed. A comfy room and clean which is the main thing for us. Breakfast was lovely and the seating area was very comfy and spacious. 24 hrs drinks was great for us coming in tired late at night. We were never around to sample the managers dinners but I am sure it would of been nice. Would defintely return. Plus we got a great rate from booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: bullbunny20
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely friendly from the get go. Got to our room and I have to say, it was awesome. Bathroom was huge, bed was comfortable, wi-fi was very reliable (never cut out once). The breakfast was great, had a lot of choices, including Mickey shaped waffle irons (which I appreciated more than my 5 year old I think). The pool is very nice, I had read on here that it's too small and that is simply not the case, it's actually a very good size. My son and I had a very nice time in Orlando and having the hotel turn out this great was the icing on the cake. If there was a thing I would change (if possible) I would add a shuttle to Universal, it's only about 6 miles away and would be so convenient to the non-Disney crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Best travel decision!”
Reviews.Author: SandyG46
Reviews.Content: A co-worker recommended this hotel and it was the best decision I made for this trip. It was perfect for me. Although it was a family vacation I had separate accommodations. When I arrived the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. I placed an order for groceries and they were in my room the next day when I returned. The suite was on the 6th floor, a corner unit with only one other suite adjacent to it. The stairs were across the hallway. It was very quiet. The one bedroom suite was spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable. The kitchen was stocked with plenty of dishware and utensils. I used the pool, the exercise room, computer room, and the laundry room. Each one was well-maintained. I stayed there for 6 nights and enjoyed there breakfast every day. They offered a good hot breakfast, eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, waffles, yogurt, cereal, juice, fruit, coffee, etc. I never went hungry. I was gone most all day and evenings so I was only there for dinner one night and it was hot dog night.....not my favorite. Their menu selection for other nights looked good. The concierge was extremely helpful with the shuttle and ticket advice. I used the shuttle several times without any problems. I always arrived at the parks before they opened, even when we stopped at other hotels for passengers. But if you use the shuttle to come back after dark be sure you get your bearings in the daylight - I got confused about the pick up location at Epcot because everything looked different at night. I wandered around for awhile before I figured out where the shuttle was. I used a taxi one day when I needed to get back at a specific time from Animal Kingdom, it was well worth the cost. This is a terrific value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellas029
Reviews.Content: We stayed their Aug 3 2011 the customer service was great.. dont take the shuttle to disney it broke down on the way back to the hotel no apologies or any thing to the effect. An extra toaster would be good during breakfast only one was available

Reviews.Title: “Perfect .”
Reviews.Author: GZVEN
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the best options in Orlando area. Great location, near to the parks, close to the malls, beautiful decor, spotless,high quality bath products, recent construction, and the rates are very good . i recommend it to everyone. maybe you can find a cheaper option, but not as good as this. another important thing : The beds and matress are great !

Reviews.Title: “Best home away from home in Florida”
Reviews.Author: MikaMi2
Reviews.Content: This was my first time ever staying at a Homewood Suites. I'd comparison shopped hotels in the area for a while leading up to our Disney vacation, and for me the modern look of the rooms and the complimentary hot breakfast and dinner made this hotel the best value. The room was spotless each day when we returned from the parks and was always well stocked. We had a nice view of the pool and were very close to the elevators. I love that the rooms have separate living and sleeping areas. The only thing I didn't enjoy was listening to the people above me sliding their dining chairs across the tile floors at all hours, but other than that, the hotel was very quiet. The location was good and seemed to be right in the middle of everything as far as Disney parks, restaurants, stores, and banks. The hotel also has a Disney shuttle, but we didn't use it because we didn't want to be stuck at any of the parks for a whole day. I will say (perhaps depending on your issue) it takes more time than it should to have issues resolved both through the hotel and Hilton. I got the run around for months and had to call customer service several times for something the former manager could've fixed before we left Florida.

Reviews.Title: “If you're brazilian, take cash with you.”
Reviews.Author: Deia37
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel in general. People who work in cleaning and breakfast area are very kind. The only problem about this hotel is that they do not accept brazilian credit cards. I bought all over Miami and Orlando with my credit cards and the only place they did not accept them was in this hotel. The manager told me it was a problem just witth 'brazilian credit cards' . I did not unsderstand, had to pay 10 nights stay in cash, so tha's why i'm not returning.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value!”
Reviews.Author: cpuuri
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here with young children for 3 nights. They include free hot breakfast and during the week they include one dinner entree option and an adult beverage. The room we had was a two room suite. It was clean and had a mid market decor. There was a full kitchen and a mini-dinette area. The room was about 800 square feet. The breakfast service was what you'd expect from a buffet. They were a little light on staff for the dinner service. The hot food items at breakfast and dinner weren't of high quality, but they were acceptable. The business center offered free printing, but they had computer issues, so we had to use the Hilton Garden Inn business center which is right next door. The hotel also offered free wi-fi internet access to the guest room. The work out facility and pool area are about what you'd expect for a 3 star hotel. If you are going to the resorts, they have a ticket agent in the lobby during normal business hours. They also offer free, limited shuttle service to WDW. By limited, I mean there are pre-scheduled drop off/pickup times. WDW and Universal are both within 10 minutes drive. I shopped extensively for hotels and there wasn't a better value in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “we'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: GemFlynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the homewood suites in April 2011. we have been to Orlando many times before but this time we had both families coming as we were getting married in Walt Disney World during our stay. so there was 12 people including 2 children in our group, so trying to find a hotel that would cater for everyone was quite difficult. We booked this hotel based on the reviews on trip advisor and from the pictures available on their website etc. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by friendly guy at reception. Everyone was so tired after the long flight but he went through checking in very quickly and within no time we were all in our rooms. The rooms were brilliant. all the couples had a large bedroom (with the biggest bed we had ever seen & the most comfortable) and also a sitting room and kitchen seperate to the bedroom. Both the bedroom and sitting room had large flat screen tvs with variety of channels. The family of 4 had the same kind of room except for 2 beds in the bedroom. All rooms have a kitchen area with microwave, full size fridge, dishwasher etc. This was a brilliant add on for all of us as we could stock up on food and drink. Breakfast was ok. You need to be down early to get the best of everything but the children & the some of the adults ("they were like "big Kids") loved the mickey mouse waffle maker. Breakfast was complimentary and was an added bonus to all of us. The pool area is a bit small and you share it with the hotel next door. Lucky for us there was 12 of us so we didn't have too much trouble getting sun beds. Most people in orlando are out at parks and shopping so the pool tends to be busier in the evening. we saw the same staff all the time and they were all very friendly and helpful. Our friend on reception remembered us and always chatted with us and came over to us when we got back from our wedding day to congratulate us. We couldn't really praise the hotel any more. Next time we're in orlando we'll definitely be booking this hotel and we've recommended it to everyone we know who's going. jus tto note that you should have a car when staying here. it's only 2 mins drive to restaurants and shops but would recommend everyone to drive.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back1”
Reviews.Author: kjk47150
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly from check-in on. We stayed for six nights on a trip to Disney and Sea World. Both are in very close proximity to hotel. Our room was beautiful and clean. Housekeeping came each day. Bed was super comfortable. The breakfast offered daily was amazing with plenty of hot and cold choices, plus you could make your own waffles! Monday-Thursday there was a complimentary dinner which was also delicious. The pool is shared with the Hilton next door, but it was never too busy to be a problem. The pool was nice sized and kid and adult friendly. Many restaurants and shops/grocery stores were within one mile. My husband loved the fitness center as well. Then interstate runs right behind the hotel, but noise was not a problem. We had a great experience and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly386
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and the staff was very helpful and courteous. Its located very close to Disney, Sea World, and Universal Studios. Only downside is that the pool area is shared with Hilton Garden Inn and the pool is somewhat small when used for 2 hotels. Breakfast and Manager Reception meals are varied and taste good. Would recommend for family extended stays.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: mniaj
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a two night stay at this hotel on my 1st visit to Orlando. I was pleasantly surprised as to how nice it was considering the places we drove past on a daily basis. First impressions were great, the hotel was clean and contemporary (evidently fairly new and well kept). All staff were very friendly and accomadating to our needs. The room was great, the kitchenette area had everything we needed and more. Not the best view but it was definitely comfortable. LOVED the jacuzzi and made good use of the gym even though the stay was short. Breakfast was nice and filling and I remember us ordering a pizza from the downstairs restaurant which wasnt bad at all either. Overall a very good stay would highly recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Homewood so far!”
Reviews.Author: TracyNCliff
Reviews.Content: We wanted a getaway for the Memorial Day weekend, so as we have Disney passes and like the water parks, we booked Homewood over by Sea World and convention center and had a very bad experience with mold on the ceiling in the bathroom, and several other annoying things. So, we decided to move to a different hotel on our second day, and I called this location and they gladly booked me a room. The day we showed up, we came early as we had just checked out of the one hotel, and the young lady behind the desk offered to keep our bags while we went out to lunch. She was very sweet and kind. After lunch, we came back to go to our room, and Zohaid, herafter referred to as "Zo" waited on us. He was so sweet, a very gracious host! I told him about our horrible experience at the other location, and he hooked us up with a wonderful corner suite, very roomy and extremely clean and comfy! No mold or torn carpet found here!! We loved it! We ended up spending the rest of the day on the property swimming and in the hot tub, instead of going to the water park, and even had dinner over at the Hilton Garden Inn, another lovely property, which we have also visited. I only hope this hotel continues to provide the excellent service and stays as clean as it is now. We will DEFINITELY stay here again. Thank you Zo, and the rest of the staff for being so kind!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Vacation043
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 8 nights from May 21-29 at this beautiful property. We stayed in a 1room suite (2 queen beds). On the 5th floor with a pool view. Very spacious,comfortable and clean room. From time we arrived til we left we had the exceptional service. Especially the staff at breakfast and dinner. Your all the best and know what service really is. Always replenishing food with a smile. Never had any issues getting room service (extra towels etc..) Many thanks to Ebony for making our trip a memorable one. The kids loved the resort style pool and basketball. Both a hit with the kids. Visited the parks during days and enjoyed the lovely pool area in evenings. We enjoyed the dinner (M-Th) and order for the Hilton Garden once. Much preferred takeout from Chevy's MexIcan and Fruddruckers and enjoy a nice dinner in the pavillion lounge. The location is close to many restaurants (Chili's, Uno's, TGIF, Fruddrukers, Olive garden and lots more! There is a Walmart Supercenter about 5-10 minutes away if you drive along Turkey Lake road. Nice guest laundry available on 1st floor. Just minutes away are the Orlando Premium Outlets (Vineland Road) and Premium Oulets International is about 20 minutes away. Preferred international ones better. Best family resort in Orlando with everything you need and more. Disney is about 10 min away and everything else isn't too far either. Very nice lobby, pool area and overall imaculate property. The 2 hotels is joined by the carribean resort pool and awesome hot tub. We'll be back and if your a family looking for a great vacation don't hestitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrampFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for our family. We had plenty of room to spread out with the separate living area. Although the breakfast was not the best, it did offer choices and the staff was very friendly. It seemed everyone waits until 9 to go to breakfast and it gets crowded and the food starts running low. The staff does try to replenish it quickly. When going down to get coffee earlier the breakfast area was quiet and there was plenty of food and table space. The pool was clean and we were able to see our kids from the hot tub. The location was great as the building was tucked behind the busy roads but everything was still close and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerbear613
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip as a couple to Orlando last fall. We planned on visiting both Disney World and Universal Studios so we wanted to find a hotel that was convenient to both. Homewood Suites was the perfect one. It's located about 10-15mins from either park so it was a great location. The hotel was beautifully updated and the rooms were very modern. The bed was super comfortable! The complimentary breakfast daily and the dinner Monday-Thursday were also a great option to have. The pool was very clean and very quiet. As a couple without children, we didn't want to spend 12 hours a day at the parks. We were able to relax at the hotel and really enjoy our stay to the fullest. If you don't want to stay on Disney property, I would recommend checking out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family with young children on Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: joni960
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites for five nights with my wife and our 5 and 3 year old boys. When we travel with the kids, we have one key requirement: We want a suite with a separate living area that has a pull-out sofa bed and, most importantly, is separated from the bedroom with a solid door that can be closed -- otherwise, the separate living room area is useless. Our one bedroom king suite had just that (see attached photo). We enjoyed the free continental breakfast each morning. You can make your own Mickey Mouse shaped waffles, which the boys loved. Previous reviewers have complained about long lines to make the waffles, but we never had to wait. We ate breakfast early each morning so we could get to the parks when they opened and we were not there during one of the peak Disney weeks but, whatever the reason, we we never had to wait to use one of the three waffle irons. In addition to the waffles, they had a variety of other rotating items throughout the week -- eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, hash browns, cold cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, bagels, toast, english muffins, donuts, muffins, juice and coffee. I was pleasantly surprised with the variety, given some of the complaints I've seen here. As for the food at the evening manager's reception, which is available Monday-Thursday evenings, I again do not understand some of the complaints. Sure it wasn't gourmet, but it was perfectly edible and our kids were fine with it. We ate dinner for free at the reception during the 2 nights of our stay when we did not have dinner plans. One night they served tortellini with garlic bread and salad, and the other night they served enchiladas with rice, re-fried beans and salad (on the 2 nights we had dinner plans elsewhere, meatball subs and stuffed peppers were on the menu). If you are a gourmond, eat elsewhere (there are tons of restaurants within a 5-10 minute drive). But if you want to fill your stomach for free and save some time while you are at it, the reception is a perfectly workable option. The room was clean and comfortable. When we left early each morning for the parks, we requested early housekeeping service from the front desk and each day the room was made-up when we returned mid-afternoon for the boys' naps. The pool area was clean and they have a nice jacuzzi. The carpets in front of the elevators were stained, but this seemed like a localized problem in a high traffic area. Otherwise, the entire property still looks new (it's about 2 years old). As others have mentioned, the hotel backs I-4 and some of the rooms front the highway. Our room overlooked the side parking lot, but you could still see the highway (see the attached photo). You could indeed hear traffic noise, especially if you stood close to the window. But we found that by leaving the fan on the A/C unit in the "on" position instead of the "auto" setting where it circulated on and off, it created enough constant background white noise to mostly drown out the traffic noise. You could still hear the occasional loud motorcycle go by, but the noise never woke us up. There is nothing within walking distance of the hotel, so you need a car. The heavily developed section of Palm Parkway (with several hotels and restaurants) runs from County Road 535 to Lake Street. The Homewood Suites is on the other side of Lake Street, across from some currently undeveloped open lots. The free Disney transportation picks up in the morning and returns in the evening, so it only works if you are going to spend the entire day in the parks. If, like us, you need to come back mid-day for naps, it is not a viable option. Downtown Disney is less than a 10 minute drive. It takes about 20 minutes to drive to the parks. There is a Winn-Dixie grocery store less than a five minute drive from the hotel if you want to stock the fridge in your room. With a AAA rate, we paid less than $100/night for this room, which was not only a tremendous value, but a fraction of what we would have had to pay for comparable accommodations at a Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I have ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler2011
Reviews.Content: I was in the Disney area for a conference...all of the conference attendees stayed at Coronado Springs, on Disney property, and I choose to stay at the Homewood Suites a few miles away...totally worth it. This was one of the best stays I have had in all my travels. As usual, the Homewood Suites is always a comfortable place to stay with great rates and huge rooms. I will always pick a HS when I can, and if I am ever back in this part of Orlando, I will pick this HS again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with choice”
Reviews.Author: CAP1953
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites, Lake Buena Vista, was the perfect property to stay with my family while I was attending a business conference. With my husband, son, and son's girlfriend in tow, the two-bedroom suite met our needs and gave us ample room for relaxation and privacy without stumbling over one another. The breakfast buffet was ample and well maintained by staff who were extraordinarily friendly and helpful. We also took advantage of the Homewood Suites' complimentary dinner one evening and found it to be surprisingly good. All in all, I found this property to be an excellent choice that met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location and an Excellent Value Too!”
Reviews.Author: AndieCMC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, near to Disney, shopping, and many restaurants. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with a fully-equipped kitchen, two queens and a sleeper sofa. The living and kitchen area as well as the separate bedroom were clean, comfortable and roomy. The pool area was decent. A few of the lounge chairs were wobbly and uncomfortable but the general atmosphere was relaxing. The hotel overall is a great value. It includes a tasty hot breakfast and they also serve a complimentary dinner Monday through Thursday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: coco_nyc2
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 stayed at this hotel over spring break for 9 days. The free breakfast and dinners allowed for a lot of flexibility- we could grab something to eat without wasting any vacation time. The room kitchen was completely stocked with a full size refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher and a full set of dishes, utensils, coffee maker, toaster, cutting board, can opener. A stop at the nearby Walmart and we were set for the week. The staff was very hard working in the dining and pool area- food and towels were constantly replenished respectively. All staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean as was the pool area. I would highly recommend this hotel to others, and would stay there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “5-star service with almost everything & excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Kenc514
Reviews.Content: The hotel was hard to find at night but once we checked into a 1BR 2 queen suite, there was nothing but the best service. The rooms were clean and the living room was ample for relaxation in the evening. Large dining area for the hot & cold breakfast and rarely delay for the mickey mouse waffle machines. The weekday family style supper & salad were appreciated for a fast meal after a long day at disney. Beer & wine were available upon request. The food service was great but I don't know why few people tip the friendly kitchen staff. Free wifi everywhere in the hotel and the business center had 2 computers and a full size printer copier to print out notes for the trip. The pool was not cold and the shallow area was safe even for an infant. Exercise machines were available at the Hilton garden inn next door but I didn't have time to try them.
