Limited coin laundry machines available. Didn't use the kitchen much with free breakfast & supper but it had all the cooking necessities when we needed them, including microwave & dish washer. Nicely located 5 minutes from downtown disney or a walmart supercenter; and not too far from seaworld. The only disadvantage was the I-4 next to the hotel which could be noisy but I was lucky to have a quiet courtyard facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: RDFL
Reviews.Content: Despite what other reviews say....we were discussing that we would most likely stay here again because it was clean. We've stayed at many hotels and it seemed very well maintained to us. The pool was heated and great for the kids, they could just walk in and there was no strong smell of chlorine. There was a little basketball court and games room that we used. We order room service one night and the food was good. We only ate the welcome back dinner once, we usually just made stuff in the room or bought while we were out. The breakfast was pretty simple but very fresh. Bonus with the breakfast and dinner was that you could bring it back to your room. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We didn't hear any noise from the highway or the pool area. I think my two little ones made the most noise. We stayed in the one bedroom suite and the rooms were a good size and the kitchen was a great bonus. The hotel was just a short drive to pretty much everything! Disney was super close and so were restaurants, fast food, gas stations, walmart and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Thorn054
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family and while the price was pretty good for a 1-br suite, I was pretty disappointed with the cleanliness level of the room and hallways. The carpets in my room were pretty gross--lots of ground in dirt, a variety of stains, etc. There was also a shirt left in the corner of the room (not sure how that escaped the housekeeping process). The room itself (aside from the cleanliness) was a good size and pretty comfortable but the cleanliness kind of offset that. We only stayed one night and I can honestly say that I would NOT stay here again or recommend that anyone stay here for a lengthy period. There are much better hotels in the area, many within walking distance to food, shops, etc. The price is right but you get what you pay for, right?? It wasn't terrible or anything like that--it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but too much traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: chefwannabe101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, all the staff was friendly and courteous. Front desk staff not too good with the directions unless you liked to ride on I 4 and follow the signs. The hotel is close to I 4 and there was just too much traffic noise for me, it is unlikely i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again definitely!”
Reviews.Author: buba09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a ground floor one bedroom room close to the parking area, which was very convenient when we came exhausted from parks or wtih shopping bags. The breakfast was very complete and you could bring it to your room. The laundry was useful too. Kitchen was great! We didn´t have time to use the pool, but it looked good! It was good value for money and with the quality of a Hilton chain.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Cathie71
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect for a family of 4. We had the one bedroom suite. It was very clean. The kitchen had all you needed including plates, silverware, glasses, can openers, cutting boards. You name it. The beds were very comfortable. We stayed here for 2 days and nights while hanging out with family and going to see Harry Potter World at Universal (which was also great) The hotel was very easy to find. A little tip. If you are going to Universal you can take a right out of the hotel and stay right on Palm Parkway it will bring you right to Universal without having to go on i_4. Only had one con which wasn't too bad. We had a room that was facing I-4. Like previous reviews you can here the traffic. Didn't keep me a wake but if you are a very light sleeper I would ask for a room on the other side. We traveled with a 9 old and 15 year old. They loved the hotel. The breakfast was okay. They had an assortment. Bacon, scrambled eggs ( a little cold) cereal, waffles, oatmeal, juice, coffee, cocoa. It did the job before heading out. We ordered room service to go (we had to head out) The prices of the food were very reasonable and also very good (chicken ceaser salad and chicken soup. There are also plenty of restaurants in the area. Olive Garden, Tgif, Burger King, etc. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value, loved the pool and jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: eprotmgnd
Reviews.Content: my 7 year old son and i stayed here for a few nights in march 2011. it was a great value for the money. we especially enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi which are really nice. they also had a nice small outdoor basketball court, a small game room and a workout room. overlooking the pool. my son loved the mickey mouse shaped waffles. in addition to free breakfast, they offer a basic happy hour 5-7 during the week with family friendly stuff such as salad bar, pizza, garlic bread, pasta, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinMan96
Reviews.Content: We try very hard to stay in hotels which have a sitting area, at least a sofa, so Homewood Suites is one of our favorites, especially since I am a Hilton Honors member. We stayed at the Lake Buena Vista location in early March 2011 for 4 nights. As others have pointed out the hotel shares the site with a Hilton Garden Inn which is used for meeting space and since it has a restaurant room service can be ordered from the Hilton Garden Inn. We spent two days in Disney World and since the hotel provides a free shuttle we had planned to take it to save the $14 parking fee at Disney. The shuttle runs 3 times in the morning (8, 10, 12) and three times at night (5:30, 7:30. 9:30) and at 11:15 if the park is open late. I didn’t like the return times too much since we had been at Disney many times and I thought we might want to leave earlier, especially since it was not crowded. So we ended up taking the car. There is a public bus (#50, $2, senior $1) which stops at the hotel and goes to Disney Downtown and Disney World (Transportation Center) which runs every 30 minutes. In the other direction is goes to Sea World, by the way. I won’t repeat all the good things others have said about the hotel, but I do want to mention that they have a safe in the room which is large enough to handle a laptop, really neat. On the other hand, like so many other hotels with flat-screen TVs, they did not have any HD channels. That’s really annoying, but I'm used to this by now.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Krissyre
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (2 adults, 3 children aged 3 to 10) stayed at the Homewood Suites for 3 nights in May, 2010, as part of our annual Disney vacation. We were torn between this Homewood Suites and the Embassy Suites just a short distance down the road, which we've LOVED for years. We felt that the 2-bedroom suite at Homewood Suites would give our family more room to spread out, which would be worth the extra money. We did like the hotel quite a bit. The location is great -- very convenient to Disney and plenty of other restaurants. The 2-bed suite was very nice -- the bedrooms were a very good size, and the bathrooms (yes, 2 baths!) was larger than my bathroom at home! The room was VERY clean and the staff was very friendly. We had originally booked the suite for 2 nights, and although we were unable to stay in that particular suite for a 3rd night when our plans changed, the staff were very helpful and accomodating in helping us move to a smaller, 1-bedroom suite for the last night of our stay. However, there were some DEFINITE downsides. The 1-bedroom just does not measure up in any way to the Embassy Suites 1 bedroom in terms of size or furnishings. Also, the free breakfast is NOTHING compared to the Embassy Suites breakfast. For example, one morning at the Homewood Suites, there was one chafing dish of (obviously powdered) eggs with peppers and onions (which my kids would not touch), some greasy sausage, and a couple of Mickey-head waffle makers for make-your-own waffles... with people lined up 6-deep to use them. We ended up making-do with stale bagels and getting lunch at the Park. At the Embassy Suites, however, we were able to get made-to-order omlettes and all kinds of other goodies, which filled us up for a day of Park-hopping. :) So, while the hotel was not bad by any means, it was not stellar either. It was not worth the extra $$ to get the 2-bedroom here vs. the 1-bedroom at the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “ANY REQUEST IS A PROBLEM....”
Reviews.Author: travelforyou02
Reviews.Content: Things were not operative....No bulb in work light,, tub stopped up AND bathroom door lock was broken. Breakfast was always cold and limited., If you didn't get therer early, you had to eat whatever was left; including the fresh fruit! Waffles were in demand becase it was a long line to get a hot waffle.. Breakfast staff of many different languages, poor communication with guests as well as each other. Asked for yogurt, gave me a banana, asked for syrup gave me margarine.Rude and lazy front desk agent gave us hand towels when we requested wash cloths. I refused them and he was not a happy camper as he retrieved the wash cloths. Same agent next morning was verbally abusive to me during the breakfast time because I complained that there was never enough items left filled for the guests(myself also). I decided after breakfast we would just check out. So during the check out process the agent decided to tell me a few things and told me to get out. When I requested a superviser he said there wasn't any available. The front desk mgr gave a complimentary night when the items went unfixed on day 2. I was highly upset after the encounter. We checked out and I finally found the Mgr. I talk at length with him and said he would get back to me. But he never did. I called for a status, i was told that the complimentary night was all they were willing to do. It was the most stressful stay I had at any hotel. No hospitality

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT ONE OF THE OTHER HOMEWOOD SUITES NEARBY”
Reviews.Author: SAHMommaCT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2011. I am a 40 year old mother from Connecticut. I stayed at the hotel with a 3 year old and two adult grand parents. Prior to our stay, we requested adjoining rooms. When we checked in, we were given rooms that were on the same floor but far apart. When we asked for closer rooms (which would have made child care easier, etc.), THE MAN AT THE RECEPTION DESK WAS RUDE and TOUGH and he was not able to accommodate our request. ANOTHER THING TO BE WATCHFUL ABOUT was that we were quoted $125 a night on the phone/Internet prior to the stay, but were charged a higher rate at the end of the stay. This is deceptive. WHEN YOU CHECK IN WATCH THE PAPER WORK THAT YOU ARE SIGNING TO MAKE SURE THE HOTEL IS NOT CHARGING MORE THAN WAS QUOTED. Also, we had a clogged toilet. When we called reception, they said that they would send down a plunger to the room. It took an hour to receive the plunger. Also as someone mentioned, they were scarce on the toiletries. (this was not a big deal the main complaint again was the rude nature of the employees at the front desk). Also, DO NOT PURCHASE DISNEY TICKETS FROM THE KIOSK AT THE HOTEL b/c they are not upgradable. For example, we purchased 2 day Disney tickets from the hotel. We decided to go to the parks for a third day. When we were at Epcot on the third day, and purchasing tickets for the third day, the woman at Epcot asked if we had purchased tickets for any prior days. We said yes, but when we showed the tickets we had purchased from the hotel, the woman at Epcot said the tickets were not upgradeable. So we paid $87 per day as opposed to $67 if we had bought 2 day tickets directly from Disney to begin with. Also, the prior review about the hotel being right on Interstate 4 was correct. It is littleraly right on the highway, so IF HIGHWAY NOISE BOTHERS YOU AT NIGHT, IT IS LOUD. Overall, the rooms were clean (the cleaning staff was very friendly), but the front desk staff was so rude that I would never stay again at this hotel. I like Homewood Suites but WOULD STRONGLY RECOMMEND STAYING AT ONE OF THE OTHER AREA HOMEWOOD SUITES.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: dhi50
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer covered almost everything that I wanted to say. In addition, it is next to a Hilton Garden Inn and they share a very nice pool area. Also, the Garden Inn has a bar and restaurant for drinks and simple meals. My wife and 2 daughters enjoyed the special drink of the day during cocktail hour each day of our stay. The food served at the Homewood Suites at breakfast and dinner was definitely not gourmet but certainly didn't merit the very negative comments of a recent review. We would definitely stay here again on future trips to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Rates, Close to All the Action”
Reviews.Author: mroberts18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our 2 year old son to Florida and stayed at this hotel for a week. We are picky when it comes to hotels, especially with cleanliness and worn out rooms. I had read a lot of reviews before booking a hotel, and we could not have been happier with our selection. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was perfect for our needs. The hotel supplied a playpen for our son to sleep in, which we set up in the bedroom. It gave us the separate living area to use at night after he went to bed to watch tv without disturbing him. It was nice having the full kitchen in the suite. We bought groceries at Winn Dixie when we arrived, which was only a 2 min drive from the hotel, and made our breakfast and lunches in the room. The hotel room was very new and modern and very clean. We found it very quiet. The hotel appeared to be at full capacity, but we never heard anybody in the hallways, or noise from other rooms. I noticed some guests on here have complained about noise from the highway, but I have to say that we faced the highway and could hear very little traffic noise. My 2 year old slept right through the night each night of our stay, so that should tell you something. The housekeeping staff was excellent with changing our garbages and refreshing our towels on a daily basis, and a very friendly bunch. They even found a way to track down what room we were staying in to return my son's shoe after he dropped it in a hallway without us noticing. Most hotels would have just sent it to a lost and found, but I thought that was a really nice touch. Whenever I called the front desk for something they were very polite and took care of our requests very quickly. If you plan on visiting theme parks then this is in a terrific location, especially for Disney. Downtown Disney is about a 5 min drive, and the Magic Kingdom less than 20 mins from parking spot to parking spot. At around $100 or so per night, this hotel is an exceptional value being that close and convenient to Disney. For the 5 min extra drive just outside of the Disney gates you save big time money and get a really great room. There are tons of family friendly restaurants just a 5 min drive to the end of the Palm Parkway. If you like Mexican I highly recommend Chevy's, we had a great meal and excellent service there. There are several shopping outlets nearby. The Lake Buena Vista outlets are 10 mins away, same with the outlets on Vineland, and the Prime Outlets near Universal are just 15 mins away on the highway. The pool area was really nice with a walk in shallow end that my son loved, and a nice hot tub, basketball court, and fitness room on site as well. If you want lots of amenities, great value, and to be close to theme parks a great shopping then this hotel is a place you should consider.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Delhielhi, National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
Reviews.Title: “Charming with value”
Reviews.Author: subramanyan_nv
Reviews.Content: I visited Orlando on business and happened to stay in this hotel. It is very close to the Disneyland and therefore literally brings out the child in you. Along with excellent rooms, the service is indeed very good. It made my stay a pleasure. Even my friends, who did not stay with me, were received with open arms and exceptionally generously when they came to visit at late hours. A place to be indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some, but NOT the best.”
Reviews.Author: mnurse07
Reviews.Content: When we visited Disney this last trip I decided to get a 'suite' style room to accomodate the 4 of us. I always do a ton of research and try to have an open mind, and thought I had found a pretty good deal. This Homewood Suites was mediocre. The front desk staff was very friendly and mostly helpful and the outer appearance was good. The room was spacious for us, and it was nice to have a kitchen to cook our food! The problem started with housekeeping, or lack thereof! The second day when they supposedly came to refresh the room we were left without dishsoap, the floors were not vacuumed, and leads me to wonder if any detergent was used to wipe the counters. I never called, as I had already called about the NON-existent water pressure in the shower. Which was immediately rectified. My second complaint was the "free" breakfast and managers reception. The food was HORRIFIC! The managers reception meal for us was Manicotti that tasted as though it had been microwaved a few times and then placed onto the buffet line after it had cooled completely! It was not even fit for animals! The breakfast wasn't any better. The only good thing were the waffles, that you had to wait for 20 minutes to get to. The powdered eggs were worse than what they serve at the hospital I work at, and the sausage was cold. I am pretty sure the food industry people should shut that portion down for things not even close to temperature!!!! I can't understand why someone would even bother to offer 'free' food if its going to be this bad just forget it! Overall, I would recommend this place if you choose NOT to eat the food and don't mind hanging out in a semi-dirty room. Just sad that Hilton brands their name on this place. It worked for us and may work again, but go down the street and eat at IHOP or something.

Reviews.Title: “Keep up the good work - we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights & found the hotel without hassle, just a 15 minute drive from MCO after a long flight from the UK. An outside beautiful fountain & bright fresh entrance area & warm welcome from the front desk made us feel relaxed immediately. Check-in was easy & then a friend travelling with us checked in. As we gathered to finish loading our luggage onto a cart, a member of the front desk staff approached us & apologised & said that she didn't realise that we were together, & would we like rooms next to each other. How kind of her & very much appreciated. Our friend went back to the front desk with the staff member & changed her room in a few moments. When we reached our rooms on the 5th floor we were all delighted. We had a very spacious 1 bed roomed suite & hers was just a fraction smaller but still spacious. Both were very clean & very well equipped. I could live there! We went downstairs a short while later for the free evening buffet & were happy with what was on offer. A bonus was the free wine & beer! We all had an excellent night's sleep & as others have said, it was near the main highway but we didn't hear a sound of any traffic. We enjoyed our breakfasts & the choice was good as it was all included. It really set us up for the day. The staff were busy replenishing items & clearing tables all the time. The hotel was busy but there was plenty of room for everyone. We didn't use the pools because we were doing other things but they did look inviting. If you wanted to have a drink in the evening or a meal you could pop across the courtyard to the Hilton. The car park was full by the late evening but there did seem to be room for everyone to park their cars. We'd stay again without a moments hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; okay ammenities”
Reviews.Author: 2dads2kids
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather new and the rooms are great if you are traveling with kids, as having the pull out couch in the living room makes for more room and space. It is rather quiet, which is nice, given that so many hotels in the area are loud with lots of kids. The pool and spa are shared with the Hilton Garden Inn property, so don't expect a lot of space/use of that area. The breakfast is nothing to get excited about; it's just a glorified, boring Hampton Inn-type breakfast that serves the SAME FOOD every morning--bland and boring. My teens still needed a breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to Disneyworld without the price of a Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: PreschoolerMom
Reviews.Content: We reached this hotel through a friend that had been there nine months before us. It was a pleasant surprise to get there and see a reasonably clean suite with all that we were looking for (an equipped kitchen, a comfortable and clean bathroom and a linving room separated from the bedroom). We stayed there for 5 days during the Christmas break in 2010. The only catch is that we had made reservations for a two queen beds and when we arrived at the hotel they didn't have one available, so they put us in a one king bed with a sleeper sofa, offering to change rooms on the following day (which we refused due to the hassle of moving luggage instead of enjoying the day in the amusement park). My personal thought is that the booking system and/or the hotel front desk people aren't very organized. The hotel room was neat but the kitchen table was small (only two chairs). We used the sleeper sofa for my children and the king bed for my husband and I. The bathroom was cleaned everyday and toiletries efficiently replaced. Our room was facing the highway, but we slept well evry night (no noise at all or maybe we were too tired to listen). The breakfast was average, but it was included in the room price, as well as the evening meals from Monday to Thursday (fast food style with a choice of salad). It got very crowded after 8am (we tried to wake up early to have breakfast and then drive to the parks). We were very pleased with the morning waitress (her name is Najat), always smiling, helpful and swet with our children. The laundry room was pretty busy in the evenings and the front desk wasn't very helpful with providing change for the washer and dryer machines (sugestion: have a coin change machine at the laundry room). We drove everyday to the WDW parking lots (about 15 minutes drive) and the hotel location was very convenient (and it's worth paying the parking fee of $14). It is necessary to have a car to stay there because if you want a grocery store, pharmacy, restaurants, etc, you will definetely need a car to move around. Very good location though: less than five minute drive to a grocery store, a pharmacy and lots of restaurants around. Overall a great choice for the budget concious WDW visitor. Whenever we go back, we are staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: travelinfarandwide
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this Homewood and would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff, especially Renee the manager and Francheska at the front desk were helpful and friendly. Renee recommended a local restaurant that was off the charts...Johnnie's Hideaway. All you can eat stone crabs on Monday nights! We're still full 2 weeks later!! :-) The suite was super clean and very well equiped. The property, adjacent to the Hilton Garden Inn was full featured and well kept. The HGI had a wonderful female bartender who was so personable and friendly. Breakfast buffet food was good as well, but the atmosphere was quite frenetic being so close to Disney and hence, full of um, "vocally expressive" kids. The free shuttle to Epcot was welcome and on time. We would highly recommend this hotel. We could have stayed anywhere...and are glad we stayed at this Homewood!

Reviews.Title: “it is great”
Reviews.Author: glimmertos
Reviews.Content: I didn`t write a review of this hotel when i got home, but after reading the negative ones here I feel i must. I REALLY liked this hotel! And for the price it is absolutly amazing. I did not think it was dirty AT ALL. The breakfast is fine, it really is! There are waffels, different kind of cereal and eggs and youghurt. and the managers reception is okay too, and if you dont like it, who cares , its free ;) You do need a car, nothing in walking distance, but alot of stuff 5-10 minuts away in car. Please, if you need a great hotel at a great price, and you have a car, this is it :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we've stayed at near Disney!”
Reviews.Author: imadavis
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything! A zero-entry pool with waterfall, free breakfast in the am...free dinner (with beer and wine) Mon.-Thurs., great one and two bedroom suites, kitchen in every room and the location was amazing! Only a mile or so to the Downtown Disney entrance off of 535! The kitchen in each room is such a nice thing when traveling with little ones. We loved every minute of our stay and plan to make it our ONLY hotel when staying over night at Disney!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: smokeybandit
Reviews.Content: Other reviews nicely summarize the positive aspects of the hotel. We were there as a stopover before flying out of MCO the next morning, not for any of the Disney attractions. Our room was clean, not at all dusty like others have experienced. We only stayed one night, but I wish we could have stayed longer to take advantage of the other suite amenities. The comments about road noise are true, but I'm a light sleeper anyway. My wife didn't notice the traffic at all. The breakfast was good...food tasted fine, though the stuff in the buffet warmers could have been warmer (though it wasn't cold). Only a couple person line for the waffle irons, which of course is to be expected. I thought the selection of food was fine. Waffles, scrambled eggs, french toast sticks, fruits, pastries, english muffins, bagels, cereal and sausage. My wife enjoyed the pool and hot tub. BTW, check out the Black Angus Steakhouse just down the road. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to feel special stay at this hotel and enjoy every minute of your stay where all staff make you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: trish7650
Reviews.Content: if you need anything all you need to do is talk to any of the staff at the main desk even the managers and they will try their utmost to help you and you can relax and enjoy every minute of your holiday with the knowledge that if you need help they are there.

Reviews.Title: “A Homewood Suites that needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: nem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are both Hilton members. We have stayed at numerous Homewood Suites throughout the USA. I love Homewood Suites because of its accomodations for families with young children. However, this one is lacking in so many ways. Pros: It was quiet and not busy during my stay The rates were great Nice size rooms 15 minutes from Epcot (entrance) 25 minutes to Magic Kingdom (entrance) Zero entry pool for children Great proximity to Downtown Disney, the Winn Dixie Grocery Store, and few restaurants (however you will need a car) Nice staff Clean lobby area Breakfast area big compared to other Homewood Suites Nice pool area Free internet (however, it's very slow. So, you may want to bring your own laptop) Inroom safe Cons: Yes, like others have mentioned the houskeeping needs to step their game up by being more attentive. My room was not vaccumed during my entire stay (I stayed over a week). The carpets were very dusty. My sheets were not changed during my stay either. Small closet Everyday during my stay I had to call the front desk for extra towels, etc. The houskeeper always forgot to place a certain item in our room rather it was washcloths, shampoo, you name it. They were very inconsistent Breakfast was not that good at all (except for the waffles) and they didn't offer a variety of items that you normally see at other Homewood Suites. I was like, "Where is the food?" Tip: Go and buy breakfast items at the Winn Dixie instead. Dinner was absolutely horrendous. No flavor and not enough variety! It taste like cafeteria food at a nursing home. After two nights of that, we ended up eating out and purchasing food at the Winn Dixie. A little wear and tear with the furniture and inside of the bathroom. I'm not trying to nick pick because I love staying at Homewood Suites. However, I felt like this particular one was cutting corners in housekeeping, food, and amenitites. I mean my room was barely stocked with items that you normally see at other HS and cleaned during my stay. Thankfully, I'm a very clean person and I kept my room clean. My stay was okay and my family was happy. So, it wasn't completely horrible. Hopefully, if they tend to a few details like the issues with housekeeping, meals, etc. I think this hotel has a great potential to being up to speed with other Homewood Suites. I personally will never stay here again. However, I think that it's an okay place to stay just for a few nights, but not around the busy season or for a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: “I can't think of a single reason to pick this hotel for your Orlando stay...”
Reviews.Author: BerthasDad
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton HHonors member, I tend to gravitate to Hilton Hotels. I have been in some pretty fantastic Hilton franchises, and, as an HHonors member, the hotel always knows what I like before I get there. For example, I prefer to be in a quiet area, away from the elevator, on a high floor. Now, I must assume that the desk personnel here are somehow passive agressive. I got the expressway-front room on a low floor, right next to the elevator. So, your HHonors status cuts no ice here. 1. About the location: It is off of the "new" Palm Parkway, next to a Residence Inn and a Hilton Garden Inn. I chose this property because of favorable experiences with an excellent Homewood in Fort Myers. The Homewood is right next to the e-way. Now, I don't mean, near it. I mean, my room was 75 feet from the traffic lane of an 8 lane (at least) freeway, (I-4) that has noisy traffic day and night. about a third of this hotel's rooms face I-4 directly. The room is separated from the traffic by a two-car-deep parking lot and about 15 feet of grass. Now, the I-4 isn't up on a hill, or down in a ditch. It is the front yard of this hotel. Harleys and semis and cars with no mufflers. 24/7. 2. More on location. There is no walking distance restaurant, or anything else. In fact, there are no sidewalks on Palm Parkway that would let you safely walk somewhere. The hotel literature in the room says that a plaza, with an overpriced grocery store and some restaurants, is "walking distance". Well, I suppose, if you walk in the road, and are in really good shape. 3. More on location. The Prime Outlets--the really high end Orlando Outlet Mall--is "across the street" But of course, the "street" is I-4. To get there, you take a circuitous 3 mile drive, through endless and confusing intersections, and it takes 20 minutes if there is not much traffic. At 5 pm, it took us 45 minutes. This is a very congested part of Orlando and every drive everywhere is a challenge. Don't be talking on the phone or texting, people drive crazy here. Now, back to the hotel: Cleanliness. I agree with the other reviewers about the dirty carpets in the hallways, elevator lobbies, and lobby. When I read that review, I was skeptical. But once I got here, I was grossed out by the filthy carpet. You sure don't want to be walking around her barefoot. It appears that the light colored carpet has never been cleaned. Or even vacuumed. As for the room, there was plenty of mold in the shower/toilet room. There really is no ventiation in there, so the shower steam just keeps it moist in there, and there was mold on the tile grout both on the floor and the walls of the shower. Of course, that could be remedied with a brush and some bleach water, but this place seems to adhere to the "five minute lick and a promise" cleaning. Seriously, the guy who cleaned our room spent 5 minutes. They put a card on the bed, "if you want your sheets changed more than every third day, please leave this card on the bed and we will do it..." And some stuff about "being green", and about how you should reuse your moldy towel. Well, even if you ask, they WILL NOT change your sheets until the third day. Doesn't matter the reason; they just aren't going to do it until you are scheduled. More on the cleanliness issue: I agree with the poster who found the dust and dirt in the room. This may be a new property, but unless they actually start cleaning the rooms, this place won't be a Homewood much longer. Homewood folks: you need to do an inspection ASAP. Food: The breakfast sucked. Period. I have enjoyed these free breakfasts at other Hilton properties. But, don't bother with this one. It was just plain nasty. The only redeeming quality of this food was that it was free. Of course, you may not want to eat it; this place draws a lot of people with little kids, and there is a lot of sneezing, coughing, and touching of the food by the little tykes. Eggs were cold(not to mention tasteless, and I suspect, powdered), and this morning, it was "turkey patties" instead of sausage. I didn't actually see anyone eat them, but lots of folks spit them out. They did have those "make your own" waffles. The line was an hour. We ended up getting our own breakfast food and making it in the room. So, if you are thinking, stay here because breakfast is free, skip that thought. Oh, and PHONE CALLS: The placard in the room says that all local calls are free, 'except...." $3 for a .2 minute call to make a restaurant res. This hotel seems to be back on the phone system guest rip off bandwagon. So, overall, this hotel was noisy, both from within and without (noisy drunk guests and screaming kids, and, of course, the freeway). It was dirty--and I don't have high cleanliness standards. I do think that if somebody is actually going in there and really cleaning, the MOLD on the tile in the bathroom might actually get cleaned up. It is poorly located. And, worst of all, it was MORE EXPENSIVE than most of the dozens of other Hilton properties in Orlando. Like I said, I can't think of a single reason to stay here, unless your uncle is one of the owners. Mark my words, this hotel will be an Econolodge soon. I can't believe that Hilton will keep them in its stable.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: adolson
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because the convention hotels were sold out and the cost was 89 a night with AAA. We could not believe what a nice hotel suite we received for the money. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning, and loved the pool and jacuzzi area. We utilized the bar next door in the Hilton Garden Inn for a nightcap each night. This was a hotel that was in between the convention center and disney and you could take side roads to get to each destination. We will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Elsailor
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great! 5 min from Lake Buena Vista, close to many restaurants and all the parks! The rooms are big and spacious, with fully functioning kitchen and plenty of storage space. The breakfast is ok. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Accom.”
Reviews.Author: durhambulls
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new property, but regardless it dererves full points!! I was upgraded to a GIGANTIC two-bedroom suite with my Hilton Hhonors Diamond status. Room was clean and modern, and even though i was in town for a conference, i will return on a vacation with my family. But please upgrade me to the same room...lol:)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaJuanSe
Reviews.Content: Nothing's perfect, but whenever things are good, we certainly have to admit they are and recommend them to other people. My wife and I were traveling with my sister, brother in law and two young nephews, and everyone loved it. We stayed four days and they stayed almost two weeks! Before we booked this hotel, we had already paid for another one, which we cancelled when read more updated reviews about it, which actually were awful. Then started our haunt againg and found this nice hotel, with very spacious and comfortable suites, which all the time were spotless and well kept. I've stayed in Best Westerns, Holiday Inns, Hilton and many other chains, but this being my first experience with Homewood, really was surprising. So PROS: great spacious rooms, nice breakfast (don't believe the reviews that say other things; we loved them), clean, convenient parking and location, staff. Few CONS: the unfriendly front desk lady who was there when we first came in. Though she "chaged a little" after that, she wasn't as friendly as the rest. The rooms that face the Highway are a bit noisy (tried one before getting onether one), though nothing really bad. Just ask for a non-highway one. I'd go back to this hotel and would recommend this chain over the other conventional ones, and they're almost at the same price range... Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value next to Disney Attractions”
Reviews.Author: MariLand
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. We arrived very late and were quickly checked in. We stayed in 2 Queen Beds Suite. There is ample parking behind hotel, you just have to drive around it. The rooms were nice size, beds nice and comfortable. Each room has flat screen TV, and one had also a DVD player. The kitchen , fridge, microwave all there. If you want to stay in your room and eat dinner the supermarket is couple miles down the road. Hotel is a little bit away from Down Town Disney. I found peace and quiet a big plus after full day of Disney Park Exploration. We used the pool & hot tub one day which was extremely nice and relaxing. My kids loved Mickey Mouse Waffles for breakfast, I was more or less ok with their breakfast selection. On Monday thru Thursday they also serve dinner from 5 to 7. There is also a restauraunt in Hilton Garden Inn next door. The food there was average. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but EXCELLENT HOTEL to stay while at WDW”
Reviews.Author: No1HotelAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that after reading some of the reviews about this hotel prior to leaving for our trip I was nervous and hesistant about staying here. Normally we stay at Staybridge Suites properties so this was the first time at a Hilton extended stay or suite hotel. We arrived around 8pm the day of our check-in and were greeted by a professional and friendly front desk agent. We had booked a studio King bed suite, but to our surprise we must have been upgraded to a one room King suite... this was awesome! The hotel looks and smells like it is brand new. Yes there are a few signs of wear and tear here and there and the hallway carpets could use a cleaning soon, but that is to be expected when you run a hotel very close to a theme park and have very little down time in the busy months to do deep cleaning and repairs. I would almost bet that they will do repairs and deep cleaning in the late fall or winter months. Anyway, the hotel is very brightly lit inside and out and is decorated with a modern touch. The kitchen had granite countertops, cherry cabinets, dishwasher, stovetop, garbage disposal, cabinets filled with pots, pans, toaster, coffeemaker, utensils, storage containers for food, plates, etc. The refrigerator was full size... the only disappointment is that it does not have an icemaker like the Staybridge Suites properties do. The living room area was rather spacious with a sofa/bed, easy chair, ottomon that serves also as a coffee table and a nice size flat screen tv with a dvd player. The bedroom had a king bed, two nightstands, dresser with a flat screen tv on it, a nice size closet with full mirrored doors, in room safe, vanity and sink which was very spacious and well lit, separate room for the shower and toilet. The bedroom area is separated from the living room by a door. The shower has a crescent rod which gives you extra room inside and the area is brightly lit. The only complaint is that they do not have a bathroom fan in the shower area and it gets very steamy and wet in the area from the shower. Hotel towels were new and very fluffy and the soap, shampoo, etc. was Nuetragena products which smelled nice. The bed itself was very comfy, high, and soft... but not too soft. They offer you hard and soft pillows on the bed, we asked for a few more and they had no problem with that. Each day housekeeping would clean the room and give us coffee, tea, and popcorn which was nice (same as Staybridge Suites). The housekeepers seemed very accomodating to your needs and requests, THE ONLY NUISANCE I found was that they were inconsistent with their daily cleaning- some days they would forget to leave soap or shampoo or towels or dishwasher soap. We would always alert the front desk and got what we needed but it was a bit of a pain in the butt sometimes. The tv has a decent selection of channels, but I would have expected a better variety considering that it is a Hilton property. The breakfast area is rather big and I never found it to be too crowded or not maintained properly. My only complaint with breakfast is that it doesn't start early enough and ends too early as well. I understand that some people get up early to go to the parks, but some of us stay at the parks late and would like to have a late breakfast and breakfast ends at 9:30am which is early compared to other hotels. The breakfast offerings were rather extensive with danish, bagels, donuts, cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juices, usually two hot offerings each day ( omlettes, hash, bacon, sausage, eggs). The best part of breakfast is that they have made to order waffles. You can make your own waffles and they offer two kinds... the regular square kind or Mickey Mouse (head) shaped waffles... that was really cool. The hotel website said that the hotel offered made to order omelettes and eggs but they simply had pre-made (probably frozen) products... this was somewhat of a disappointment. Overall though, breakfast was good. Parking can be a problem at this hotel as it seems like they only have enough spots for exactly the number of rooms they have... meaning, if you arrive late at night you have to search and search for a spot and it is probably in a non-desirable area of the hotel and not close to an entrance. The hotel is located right next to I-4, but we never heard any traffic noise from our room and we always knew how traffic was flowing on I-4 before we left the room. My only big complaint about the hotel is that it is definitely off of the beaten path. It is on the Palm Parkway which in Lake Buena Vista has hotels, restaurants, and shops on it... HOWEVER, where the hotel is located is a newer undeveloped section of the Palm Parkway and there is literally NOTHING around you but undeveloped land. You cannot walk to restaurants and shops, plus it is quite a drive each day to State Road 535 which goes through the heart of Lake Buena Vista. Still, because the hotel was new and offers a lot it was not bad being quite so far away. We were still close to Downtown Disney which was awesome. OVERALL- 1. The hotel is like brand new and is very clean. 2. The breakfast is quite nice. 3. The Mickey Mouse waffles were awesome. 4. The suites are quite spacious. 5. The hotel is off the beaten path and further away from the rest of the hotels and restaurants in Lake Buena Vista. 6. There is nothing around the hotel as far as restaurants and shops ( just undeveloped land). 7. Parking seems to be at a premium when the hotel is busy, sold out, or if you arrive late! 8. FREE hotel wifi was also good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pontoondriver
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable and quiet at an excellent price. Our particular room had a separate living room/kitchenette area and bedroom. The included morning breakfast was more than adequate and although we did not partake in the evening weekday meals, they too looked good. For a traveling family, this is a real bargain. The staff was extremely courteous. Will definitely stay here again, when we are in the Orlando area

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: avgfamily6512
Reviews.Content: In planning a family vacation to Orlando, I was initially a little worried about staying at the Homewood Suites - Lake Buena Vista due to some earlier reviews. However, I decided to go ahead and chance it, as I have always enjoyed other Homewood Suites. I'm glad I did. I have no complaints about my stay. Indeed, I found the staff at the hotel to be extremely helpful. Being able to purchase Disney tickets in the lobby was very convenient (and they even offer a free shuttle to Epcot - save you $14/day parking at Disney). Breakfast food quality was fine if not great (though the kids loved the Mickey Mouse waffles), and the M-Th dinners were good as well, and saved us a pretty penny too. There were several days when we (and many other guests) showed up just before breakfast was supposed to end. The staff still took great care of us, bringing out more food, even after breakfast was supposed to be over. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,very clean,spacious rooms and comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: USA80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable with clean suites and kitchen with refrigerator,microwave and electric stove.Everything very clean.The pool is nice with the outside jacuzzi.Only the water was very cold in the pool.The breakfast was good only some days very crowded so we had to wait in line for the toaster or waffles.But all together we were very satisfied and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY!!”
Reviews.Author: sophieelb
Reviews.Content: I don't ask very much more from a hotel than to have clean rooms, and for a hotel that is new the maintenance obviously lacks. The bathroom had hair from previous people. The bedskirt and in between beds had so much dust and dirt and even old chewing gum wrappers, it was obvious that it had never been cleaned. The carpet hadn't been vacuumed and the carpet in corridor was stained and dirty. It was very dissapointing but it was too late when we realised it, it all seemed okay at first sight. The hotel also overlooks I4 which I didn't care for.

Reviews.Title: “not as new”
Reviews.Author: bella246
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, but not as nice as last year. The carpets around and in the elevators are really stained and dirty. My bed skirt had a ugly stain on it, and there were hairs in my shower that weren't mine. Also toilet was stained. I really liked this property, but it needs better attention. I didn't try the breakfast this time because in the past it was a hit or miss. I hope management fixes whats needs to be fixed because this is a very nice hotel, with good extras. Touch up paint is a good start.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Value for money”
Reviews.Author: johnPerpignan
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we'd visited a Homewood property,and I have to say we were all really impressed. OK,for those who like "boutique" places,then this will not do,but for a large family group,nine in our case,all of whom like their food and drink,and appreciate clean,comfy rooms,then it's hard to beat. The rooms are spotlessly clean,and the breakfast in the lounge is more than adequate,as are the pm snacks. There was never a problem finding a seat,nor the 3 car parking slots we needed. The same goes for the pool loungers,and the pool/spa area was fine,tidy and convenient. Compare this to a number of places we've been over the years,where seats,car spaces and pool space was a mad scramble each night. I guessthis is a fairly new property,and might be "discovered" by the package groups,but ,till then it's hard to think of a better choice for those wishing to visit Disney,Universal or Int'l drive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karlipants
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was nice having a kitchen and a bedroom.. The pool was nice, not overcrowded. The location is not so bad, but we did have our car with us. The only downfall to a car is paying for parking at all the parks. Around 15 dollars a day if you go to disney. The only problem I had with this hotel, was the way the elevator smelled. It smelt like B.O. and sun tan lotion.. They need to bleach those at some point, because it was really bad.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: viveksid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very clsoe to all the major attractions in Florida. The ambience is excellent and the stafff is more than helpful. The hotel has ample space for kids to play and have fun with a kids room and a seperate swimming pool for kids. the breakfast spread is superb and the icing on the cake is the MANAGERS BRUNCH which means unlimited drinks wine, beer and food for allresidents between 700 to 1900 hours. The stay was very pleasant !!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant place to spend a few nights”
Reviews.Author: kmrau
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here in June 2010. The property seems fairly new and has been maintained really well. Check-in was smooth and the the room was in immaculate condition. The only real issue with the hotel is its location. There are several hotels closer to the Disney attractions and there really isn't anywhere you can get to without a car if you decide to stay here. In spite of the somewhat poor location, I would still recommend this hotel. You'd be hard pressed to find a better hotel in the Lake Buena Vista area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: castles117
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience! The words “customer service” and “integrity” mean nothing here. Three months before my visit to Florida, I made guaranteed reservations for 3 rooms at this hotel. Upon arrival, I was told that they type of rooms I had reserved were not available. The front desk clerk (Francescka) lied and told me that there was no difference between a suite and a “deluxe” suite. (The next day I overheard her tell another guest a completely different story.) Instead of being put in the deluxe suites that we reserved, we were given 2 regular suites and a studio suite. I asked to speak to the manager. I was told that he would call me in my room. Of course, he did not call. I later found him and explained the problem. The manager’s name is Thomas McGrath. He shrugged and simply said the rooms weren’t available and there wasn’t anything that he could do about it. I asked if we could be moved to the correct rooms the next day, and he said that we would be. That was a lie. We were never moved to the correct rooms. Upon checkout, Wilmarie asked if we would like the hotel’s facebook address. I told her that we did not and that we had a terrible experience at the hotel. She did not even bother to ask if we wanted to speak to a manager. Upon returning from vacation, I contacted Hilton International to register a complaint. They asked the general manager of the property, Tony Keathley, to contact me. Although Mr. Keathley sent me a generic e-mail indicating that he had been asked to contact me, he never responded to any of my questions. NEVER! Upon analysis of my hotel bill, I learned that not only were we not given the rooms that I guaranteed with a credit card, but we were charged a HIGHER RATE for smaller rooms. Since when can a guaranteed reservation be changed so that guests are charged a higher rate for smaller rooms? In response to the lack of professionalism and lack of communication, I have registered a complaint with the attorney general for Florida. I will let him decide whether it is legal for a guaranteed reservation to not be honored. This hotel and the terrible management skills of Mr. McGrath and Mr. Keathley have made me despise Hilton as a brand. I will take my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sdrhw
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. I was thoroughly impressed with the price, amenities, and the employees. I had a one bedroom suite and it had plenty of room and was clean. Location to Disney, eating, and shopping is great. I recommend this hotel to anyone. Complimentary breakfast was great and homecoming meal was great as well. To sum it up in one word - impressed

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for 10 days”
Reviews.Author: disneymay2010
Reviews.Content: Really nice no fuss clean hotel but with great service, friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is new in a nice quiet part of tourist area. Close to everything. Disney, Wal-mart for groceries and souvenirs, shopping outlets, and dining options. Free breakfast was fun with the mickey waffles but gets very crowded making it. Rooms were comfortable, full size fridge a plus. Kids enjoyed the pool. Shout out to Shirley the concierge, the front desk and kitchen crew thanks to a memorable fun visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “clean and new but watch out for the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy23Dc
Reviews.Content: this hotel is clean, and newish. It seems to be nicely maintained. The free food breakfast and dinner are stocked with inexpensive food, but you can make a meal with it. Just don't have high expectations. Wanted to warn travelers that after one swim in the pool and hot tub, our newish bathing suits had holes in them. Something with the pool chemicals was definately not right and management was not on top of it. So, having to get new bathing suits definately added to the cost of our stay (women's bathing suits are pretty expensive!). Also, it was alarming to us that we (both adults and children) were put in this danger of uncontrolled pool chemicals.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Amazing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmartin98
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel -- feels like upscale comfort! Beautiful grounds and hotel lobby and rooms. Rooms are real suites with separate bedrooms, full kitchens, dining table, sofa bed, Internet, 2 TVs, etc. Beautiful, tropical pool and jacuzzi area. Breakfast was very good...Mickey Waffles were a HUGE hit with my kiddos. Bonus...dinner buffet Monday-Thursday nights. Best value for an awesome upscale hotel! Staff is so great....Disney tickets sold on site...restaurant and small store on site too! So close to Disney and many great restaurants. We will be staying here any time we are in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in the Diney Area”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINMANFROMNJ
Reviews.Content: I travel alot , especially to the Disney area. After a long 10 trip with stops in Tampa, Disney and Boca Raton, I have to say this is the best hotel I've stayed in a long time. Being a Hilton VIP memeber i tend to stay at Hampton Inns alot. This hotel is fae exceeded my expectations. A full kitchen, lots of room to work or relax, free internet and decent TV channels were a bonus. Free Breakfast was perfect for me, but I did not try the dinner. The staff was great as well, pkus there was room service from the hotel next door. The only downsides are the number of kids running aound (but hey its Disney, not Vegas) and lack of parking (esp when i got back late at night). Another bonus is teh location, its off the beaten path but has easy access t o Disney, Universal and Seaworld, You can go out teh back way and bypass all the Disney traffic and jump right on I4 and go out to teh other parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: tourist135
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after a conference at another hotel in the I-drive district. This hotel is far superior in every aspect including the price. The rooms are bright and clean. Didn't like the couch too much but that isn't a deal breaker as the armchair was more than comfortable. The bed was outstanding. Got a great night's sleep on it. Really close to Disney without being too close. Didn't use the pool but it looked good. Game room is a nice feature. They even have a basketball court and huge fitness room. Will definitely stay here again, hopefully when visiting Disney!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Disney Travelers”
Reviews.Author: YellowJacket26
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel and things are in pretty good shape. It shares the property with the adjacent Hilton garden, which has bar service and a cafe. The suites are spacious enough with the only downside being that the bathroom is located in the bedroom, so you must go into the bedroom to get to it. The breakfast is not great, but its fine for a quick bite of cereal and a banana before hitting the parks. The zero depth entry pool is great for small children. I've stayed here twice in the last six months and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ATourist2day
Reviews.Content: We had two connecting rooms and lots of space. Location is off the main road yet close to Disney, restaraunts and even a Publix to stock the kitchen. We also ordered room service one night from the restaraunt next door at the Hilton Garden Inn. Food was delivered fast and hot. A nice alternative to going out after a long day walking at the Theme parks. This hotel is about a year old. Decor is a notch above the Residence Inn next door which we stayed at in 2008. Will definately recommend Homewood Suites to friends who want the most space and comfort for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Clean Place to Stay with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: chicago_girl6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip and the hotel is new and very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful at check in and again when I had questions about the best way to get back to the airport. The roooms are large and clean and the bed was really comfortable. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest, affordable, and convenient places I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: Iplumb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Its new, clean well staffed, courteous and helpful people from the maintenance staff, kitchen crew, and front desk personal. Its a great location, easy to get to Disney parks, Sea World, Universal, Boogy Creek Alligators, and a huge mall for when it rains. The breakfast buffet was extremely handy, and varied daily - lots to choose from. The kitchen was perfect, it didn't take away from the overall room size and it gave the option of making some easy snacks for between meals, you certainly could cook in it but hey, I am on vacation, why should I cook?? The free shuttle was really handy to get to Disney, 3 times a day for drop off AND pick-up, super cool. Having a car is a great plus, there is a "main drive" about a mile away with tons of eating and shopping options but it would be a bit of a walk without a car, you could take a taxi easily and cheaply - once you get to the main drive there are dozens of popular nationwide restaurants. I will definitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcox03
Reviews.Content: This a beautiful new Hotel, very clean and comfortable. There was free breakfast and dinner which were both perfect for our family. The location can't be beat. It is close to everything, yet away from the streams of people. The pool area is beautiful as well. We will be going back and we are looking forward to it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lampelights
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites Lake Buena Vista, Florida in December of 2009 and also February of 2010 for seven nights each time. We were a bit worried in December due to some of the reviews. We should not have been concerned. We had a wonderful time and found the staff, service, and accommodations all friendly and just what we expected as repeat Homewood Suites customers. We were very pleased with our stay. Our King Study Suite was nicely decorated, well equipped, and very clean. The hotel not only serves a large buffet breakfast with a couple hot entrees, but they also serve a complimentary light dinner with wine and beer Monday through Thursday nights. We had dinner three times in our two stays and found it tasty and abundant. We will definitely book this hotel again when we stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Lake Buena Vista - Very nice but ...”
Reviews.Author: bcf4972
Reviews.Content: All in all this is a very nice hotel. Good location. We booked and paid in advance which saved us some money. Hotel was clean. The housekeeping staff attentive and extremely efficient. Rooms were clean and crisp. The morning breakfast was adequate but there were several large groups there and the breakfast and welcome home dinner were extened by 1/2 an hour. Only complaint was we were accused of smoking in a non smoking room and were left a note by the 'manager' that he went into the room and smelled smoke. Neither of us have ever smoked. We suggested that possibly it was the adjoining room next door that we were not associated with. He insisted no it was us and if it happened again we would be asked to leave. Apparently a change of heart was had by this manager because we were not asked to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Padstack
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in early March while on business. I was checked in quickly and told about the manager's reception and free breakfast the following morning. My room was clean and spacious. Although I did not use the kitchen, I did check and found that there was pots and pans in the cupboards. The Manager's Reception was as I expected. The servers were quick to replenish my dirnk. They served pasta that night and it was rather tasty. During the short time I was in the reception area, I could see that they were putting out fresh food as soon as needed. Breakfast the following morning was cheese omletes, which left a lot to be desired. They did not taste that good and I could not finish the one I got, but there were bagels, cereal and pastries to fill up on. Overall, I would definitely plan on staying here again when I am back in twon for business. It would also be a good place for a family to stay as it is close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value - one glitch that was corrected”
Reviews.Author: hoyvenon
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid-March for 4 days in studio. Room rather large for a studio. Nice HD TV. Free high-speed internet worked fine. Bed was comfy, room and hotel very clean. Exercise room has some decent modern equipment (3 treadmills, 2 orbitals, 1 reclined bike, some loose barbells). Outdoor pool and hot tub looked okay, although the weather was a bit cool for any pooling. The free breakfast was okay - your standard scrambled eggs, bacon, breads/bagels, cereals, make-your-own waffles, juices, some fruits, oatmeal, etc. The pretentious "eggs benedict with sundried-tomato and truffles" type might whine, but it's plentiful, the quality is okay, and it's free. The evening free meal is hit and miss. I loved the free "stadium-sized" hot dogs (my "by-products" guilty pleasure), but the chesse ravioli was a "miss". Staff was very pleasant. Paid $99/night. Only glitch: The first two nights, I was stuck in a room facing eight lane I-4 interstate. I'm a poor sleeper to start with, and this was a problem. Due to it being spring break period with families and hotel sold-out, they couldn't switch me to an interior room until 3rd night. So that's why only 4 stars instead of 5 stars. If you make a reservation, call the hotel as a follow-up and ask to get a room NOT facing the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Food Service not even close to Homewood Suites standards.”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPhotoguy
Reviews.Content: I frequent Homewood Suites, when staying for several days at one location. I use Trip Advisor before making this reservation. I looked at all the reviews of this hotel where the breakfast and evening reception were criticized, and thought to myself that it could not be true. Although the room was fine for our needs, it was not as advertised. There were no pots & pans in the room, nor was there a microwave. When we questioned about the microwave, we were told that because it was a handicap accessible room, there was no room for it. It was a first for us, and turned out to be a big deal, since the hot water dispenser in the breakfast room had obviously been used for coffee at one time. What can I say about the breakfast other than it was not like any of the other Homewood Suites that we have stayed at. This is ironic in that I saved a full page add for Homewood Suites, from the USA Today, showing a full buffet, This was nothing of the sort. Most days, it was hit and miss as to if there was food in the steam tables. Some days there were pastries, some days there were not. I have been to economy motels that have had their act together better than this. As far as the evening reception, we visited one night, to find one side full of frozen hamburger patties, that had a weird grey color to them. I am not sure how they were cooked, maybe they were microwaved. That was all it took for us to take our dinners elsewhere. I realize we got a good rate and the breakfast is free, but come on people, use some imagination. Visitors that frequent the chain, come to expect something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MIAAlex
Reviews.Content: So I booked this hotel last min the night before and was very satisfied. The hotel looks like it is in the middle of nowhere but it is right in the middle of everything. Its like 2 miles from Disney and 6 miles from Universal. We got to the parks very quickly. There are a bunch of good restaurants around the corner which was also a big plus. The room was great. I got a King studio suite, the room was very clean and had all the comforts of home. The breakfast was included and was pretty good. You can make your own waffles and the rest of the food was good. I would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient and affordable option for the Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: cigar95
Reviews.Content: I found this property to be convenient to Disney, Universal, Sea World, and the city of Orlando. The rates for a true two-room suite were very reasonable. A full kitchen with glassware, not plastic, including full-size refrigerator. It's new, and it feels that way. Two things I really appreciated were the breakfast buffet, which includes a number of "healthy" items served in a roomy dining area, and the fitness room, which has more variety and more room than other similar hotels I have experienced. Also includes a high-def TV in both the living room and the bedroom. I would not hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “a great travel experience”
Reviews.Author: mijase
Reviews.Content: first the hotel is incredibly clean I felt the floors were even clean enough for my 2 yr old The carpet was spotless bathroom spotless The general manager of the hotel was fabulous kind helpful surprisingly very aware of his guests and their comfort.The rooms are spacious and the pool clean and lovely.I travel with 3 children often for sport competitions and this hotel is perfect. Less than 15 min. from disney wide world of sports. I suggest bringing a small dishsoap so as not to run the washer for a few items.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wfg0903
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and myself arrived January 5 for a five day stay, and we could not have been more pleased with our stay (other than the weather...did not get above 37 degrees the entire time we were there....had to scrape my automobile windshield every morning...ugh!). The hotel was clean and spotless, and the employees were courteous and helpful. Our queen delux suite was much larger than we expected, and our housekeeper was wonderful. The breakfast was exceptional...different items each morning, and the evening "meal" was plentiful. This hotel is an exceptional value, and we would recommend it to anyone, including families with children. We have stayed in many Hilton's over the years, and this one is the best bargain yet. We would recommend that you try and reserve a room with a pool view as opposed to the highway view due to traffic noise. Other than that..this is a hotel that I will return to if we come back to Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Cherylh407
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood Jan. 1st for 2 nights. We reserved a two bedroom suite. Check in was fast and efficient. The suite, room 725, was clean and very large. Traveling with two teenagers, we really appreciated having two bathrooms and extra room to spread out. The beds are comfortable with nice linens.....and I love sleeping on down pillows! The staff was always pleasant and helpful. Breakfast in the mornings was busy and crowded, but the staff did their best to make sure they kept up with cleaning the tables etc. Next trip, we will spend the entire vacation at Homewood. Although it was much too cold to use the pool, the area was beautiful and well maintained. Free high speed internet was also a welcome amenity. For the money, Homewood Suites can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: Pataruco
Reviews.Content: Incredible experience, everything is new, excellent breakfast, huge rooms, free wifi, well located, all that for that low price?? 61$ a night, what a gift.. definitely would recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nepean03
Reviews.Content: We had two suites (717 & 718) for 15 nights beginning December 23rd. The rooms were spotless and the staff friendly. The hotel was fully booked and the maid on our floor had 25 suites to clean daily. She was always friendly and worked dilegently to get her work complete. The morning breakfast has plenty of choice and the evening reception also varies. The only complaint about the "free" food is that it could be kept hotter. We were there during the worst cold spell that Florida has seen in 60 years. The pool was absolutley cold. This was the case even before the cold weather arrived. The pool is in the shade and I don't believe it is well heated. The hot tub on the other hand was superb. The only negative thing was the traffic at Palm Parkway and SR535. It was a nightmare and getting out of the area sometimes took 45 minutes. It did get better after the holidays but that intersection needs work. Many new hotels have been built on Palm Parkway and I don't believe the roadway can handle it.] We enjoyed the extra space. The beds were wonderful and my BIL who never can sleep in hotels admitted that he slept like a baby. The neutrogena bath products were excellent and well supplied. Having a full refrigerator makes live much easier for snacks and drinks. We would definatley stay here again. Nepean

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ! Super Location ! Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Jeepmancrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Dec 25 - Jan 2. Great hotel, very c lean, and excellent staff. Ive been to 6 or so times and this hotel is the best located ive stayed at. Only minutes drive to the outlets stores, florida mall, other shops and restaurants. This hotelk is only 5 minute from the pointe. Shopping, restaurants, movie theater, bars, etc.. I read other reviews regarding hotelk staff being slack, and not helpful, I did NOT experience any problems at all. Staff were superbe. The only complaint would be the rooms were a little drab, But thats it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vacation1109
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and wish we had stayed longer. The hotel was very clean and the beds very comfortable. The breakfast and after noon hospitality was great. Would stay there again if in the area. Will check out Homewood Suites in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy Visit”
Reviews.Author: bob1223
Reviews.Content: My family of four decided on a quick trip to Disney and booked a room at this hotel. After a long rainy drive we arrived to a very pleasant stay. Upon arrival we were greeted with a smile from the guest service represanative. The hotel room was very clean, spacious and quiet . The food at breakfast was good along with the employees working there. The location was very convient to Disney. My family will be staying again . Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, beautiful facilities and great location.”
Reviews.Author: morrison1191
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and greeted us on arrival. Our room was very clean and comfortable. There were computers available for my teens to access the internet. We were very near a variety of restaurants, gas stations, the freeway and Disney theme parks. We were in close range to three outlet malls. The staff provided a pre-printed Google map to our destination (using side roads and avoiding traffic). The complimentary breakfast had a good selection including make-your-own waffles, eggs, bacon/sausage, cereals, muffins/breads and several beverage options.

Reviews.Title: “Tips for people who have a car, and schedule times for shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Booooorin
Reviews.Content: I just came back like 2 days ago from ORLANDO - FLORIDA, I have been planning this trip for more than 4 months ... Have been going back and forth to many different sites to find the best rate offer, I was down to 10 hotel... This hotel was not one of my choice, reason being that there's no pictures, and no rating at all since it's a very new hotel. Don't really trust anything that doesn't have any review or pictures. Close to maybe 2 week prior to my vacation, the pictures from this hotel is finally posted on most of the major websites, ie: Expedia, Travelocity, sell off vacation, etc... Rates on their main web page was $89.00 with smoking rooms available. On Expedia, they have a lower rate but smoking room is not guarantee, so I decided to call them to book it and see what kind of rate they can give me. The lady on the phone was very nice and patient, she offered me a Studio King Size bed with smoking for only $69.00. I wanted a one bedroom, but with that rate, Studio it is. Later I found out that we also get the follow: FREE BREAKFAST FROM MON - SUN, FREE PARKING, FREE WIFI IN THE ROOM, FREE INTERNET IN THE LOBBY, FREE SHUTTLE BUS TO DISNEY, FREE DINNER MON - THUR. I've read a lot of other review about this hotel. Everyone seems to complaint about the breakfast. To be honest with you, I think they've improve. Who ever said the table was dirty, blah blah blah blah blah and that they don't refill the food, stuff like that. I have no problem with any of that. The tables might not be cleaned right away after people leave, but there's only 2 people working and what do you guys really expect? This is only a 3 star hotel, and this is FREE... if you want a better service ... then why don't you visit a 5 star and pay 6 times as much? I am sure they can do better... but with the rate that we are paying and with free breakfast? this is not bad at all ... IT'S a GREATTTTT hotel... Dinners are not the best... I mean if you have kids.... they would love the food and the service... but if you are looking for a full meal and stuff... they are just not for you ... but I've eaten there like twice... and the taste are not bad at all ... just not the kind of food that I would want to eat on a vacation. PEOPLE! DON'T EXPECT YOU GET RIBS AND STEAK FOR THE RATE OF $69.00 A NIGHT WITH FREE BREAKFAST/DINNER OFFER.... I have to admit that the location is not the best though, or let's just say that if you are not planning to rent a car to go around, don't stay at this hotel. Since this is a new hotel, it's basically located somewhere far in the woods (I'm guessing there's going to be more things build around it at a later time) but for now, you'll see no cars, malls, shopping center, restaurant, in a walking distant. There's no restaurant in this hotel either... so if you don't have a car... don't stay at this hotel... Shuttle bus service is not the greatest either... here are the schedule going to 8:05, 10:20, 12:25 and pick up times are 5:30, 7:30, 9:45. If you miss the bus... it's a two hour wait in between. Plus, this shuttle bus ONLY takes to you EPCOT... but if you are planning to go to other parks, you can exchange buses at EPCOT.... Taking a taxi will cost you $25-30 from EPCOT. P.S When I checked in to the hotel, we didn't get a studio, we got a deluxe one bedroom king size bed. WE GOT UPGRADED !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mccordck
Reviews.Content: Within the last 6 weeks we have stayed there 3 times with another trip planned in December. It is a very clean hotel with spacious rooms. The breakfast is a nice as well. The employees are very helpful. We go to Disney frequently and plan on always staying at this hotel. We have stayed at many, many different hotels since we got our passes to Disney World 8 years ago, and finally found one we LOVE! Much bigger and much nicer than Disney moderate resort with a Disney value resort price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Calming, Very Homey”
Reviews.Author: kary84
Reviews.Content: Picking this hotel was a great choice. I enjoyed staying there. I walked into the room (studio) and was taken aback. It was very calming, I hate lots of multi-colored stuff especially bedding, but this was just the way I like it. They even had a flat screen tv. Most hotels don't they have those dino tv from 1910. The bathroom was huge and I mean huge. The breakfast was delicious that was served every morning from 7-10, the only bad thing is they need a bigger breakfast area where they put the food for you to self serve. Unfortunately I did not take any photos (lol). But I will be staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “best value in the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: new hotel next to I-4 exit #68, but no noise from freeway noticeable. Had quick and friendly early check in. As typical for Homewood Suites, open lobby connects to breakfast resp. social hour area. Disney desk available. Hotel has several elevators which connect to your suites with 2 lcd-tv's offering lots of channels including 5 free HBO's ! Suites very new, clean and roomy. Our 1bedroom suite offered 2queens and a small kitchen with a large fridge/freezer unit, microwave and 2-pit oven. All kitchen utilities available. Our pool view was limited. Breakfast was sufficiant and plentyful and the social hour offered from monday until thursday is unbeatable making it an extraordinary added value: food, beer and wine offered with a personal touch of friendly staff. Pool is not heated and very cold. Hot tub is available and has a nice waterfall touch. For the Walmart-Supercenter turn right, straight ahead for approx 3,5 miles.
